Jael L. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive en el barrio la Pradera que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por ser de clima frió, tiene una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, también salen a la ciudad a ejercer varias actividades, muchos también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

Nuestra socia se dedica a atender la tienda que tiene hace 5 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, en sus tiempos libres también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos Avon, lleva 3 años en este negocio y estos productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad y visitando a sus amigas y conocidas.
 
La Señora. Jael tiene 57 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 33, 31, 20, 18, 15 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven  independientes con sus familias, el tercero y cuarto de sus hijos estudian en la universidad y su ultima hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es ebanista y labora en su taller propio, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en  el banco comunal y fue  invitada por una amiga a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres triunfadoras.  El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en más productos para su tienda. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs Jael L. is a member of the “Siempre Amigas” (Friends Forever) community bank.  She lives in La Padrera neighborhood in Valle district.  This district is noted for its cold climate.  It has a beautiful view of nature.  The people from this area work as farmers and raise animals.  They also travel to the city to carry out different business activities.  Many have migrated in search of a better job.

Jael serves in the store which she has had for 5 years.  She works every day from 6 in the morning until 10 at night.  In her spare time she also sells Avon products.  She has been selling Avon products for 3 years and she sells in the city and when visiting her friends and acquaintances.

Jael is 57 years old.  She is married and has 5 children aged 33, 31, 20, 18 and 15.  Her eldest two children are married and live with their own families.  Her third and fourth children are studying at university and her youngest daughter is in high school.  Her husband is a cabinet maker who works in his own workshop.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

This is the fourth loan that Jael has had from her community bank.  She was invited to join this group of successful women by a friend.  The money from this loan will be invested in buying more products for her store.  Her biggest dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy food products such as sugar, rice, eggs, oil, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita E. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Lolita is married and has three adult children. To make a living Lolita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling everyday products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and convenience foods in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010 Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional stock. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia M. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba. She is 56 years old, married and has 6 children, 5 of them are adults and only one is school-aged. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting assorted crops to sell. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used for educational purposes. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Alicia from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For educational purposes.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene carga familiar, reside junto a sus padres en un sector urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona conocida a nivel nacional por su abundante movimiento de transporte y comercio, es la región Lambayeque.

Luis se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros). El brinda su servicio en la periferia de la ciudad y se vale de el para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su mototaxi ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a reparar su moto y a adquirir algunos accesorios adicionales.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 22 years old, he is single and he doesn’t have children. He lives with his parents in a suburban region of the city of Chiclayo. It is a region nationally known for its transportation services and commerce. It is in the region of Lambayeque. 

Luis provides transport services with a motorcycle rickshaw (a motorized vehicle which consists of a motorcycle equipped with a cabin where both cargo and passengers can be transported). He provides his services throughout the city. It is a valuable business because it covers his personal expenses and he is able to contribute to the household finances. 

Continuous use of the rickshaw has caused wear and mechanical breakdown and it needs urgent repair to keep it running. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles and it will help him repair the rickshaw and he will also purchase some additional accessories.

loans.use: To carry out maintenace repairs for his rickshaw.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia lives in Gujranwala, a mid-sized city in Pakistan, known for its rice industry. She lives with her family in the area of Sabri chowk in a 2-room brick house. She moved here 22 years ago. Safia is married to M. A., 42 years old, who is involved in a construction supplies sales business in the market. Safia is the mother of 3 sons and a daughter. Her elder son works with his father in his construction supplies business and the other children attend a local school.

Safia supports her family financially by making artificial flowers. She supplies these flowers to different gift shops and also sells decoration pieces. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies, such as cement, bricks and sand, in bulk and increase his sales. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Safia is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to it. Safia is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, Safia is holding a book (called the Asasah passbook).

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Nida's Group

texts.en:
Nida G. is from the village of Villa Luna, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Nida is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nida is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Nida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn M. is from the Barangay of Labo, Ozamiz City, M. Occidental. She is 33 years old. Anelyn is married and has two school-age and two infant children. To make a living she has been working at her business for almost six years and earns approximately $345 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. She is requesting an additional loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her work to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her buy and sell accessories business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 38 years old and runs a taxi business. He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access loan easily. Therefore, he has managed to grow his business. He hopes to open other businesses in the future. He has been guaranteed a loan of 40, 000 KES with his group member in Faulu Kenya. With the loan, he will repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his car.

loans.name: Féhintola

texts.fr: Monsieur Féhintola exerce comme activité la vente de pièces détachées et tire assez se revenus pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Il a commencé depuis 2003 et s’approvisionne en gros au grand marché de Lomé. Il revend les pièces dans un magasin à Hedzranawoé. Il est très accueillant ce qui l’aide à avoir du jour au lendemain plus de clients. Aussi il a employé dans le magasin 2 personnes qui l’aident. Il demande un prêt pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Il habite quartier Yayrakomé, un quartier périphérique de Lomé.
texts.en: Mr. Féhintola is in the business of selling spare parts and generates enough income to support his family. He has been in business since 2003 and buys his merchandise wholesale at the large market in Lomé. He then sells the parts in a store in Hedzranawoé. He is very welcoming which helps him have a very loyal clientele. Also, he has two employees that help him with the store. He is asking for a loan in order to handle the increasing demand for his products. He is married and has four children.  He lives in the Yayrakomé neighborhood in the outskirts of Lomé.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Ronald Steve

texts.es:
Ronald tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de La Victoria, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
 
Se dedica a la carpintería metálica.  Brinda el servicio en un lugar acondicionado dentro de su casa donde atiende a sus clientes.  Los ingresos que obtiene los invierte en el sostenimiento económico de su familia, a quienes quiere darle una mejor calidad de vida.

Ronald quisiera comprar más herramientas para su negocio, ya que su demanda ha incrementado.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Ronald is 24 years old, single, and has 2 children. He lives with his family in La Victoria district, which is located 10 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque department.
 
He is a metalworker, and offers his services in an air-conditioned place within his house where he can attend to his customers. The income he earns he invests in maintaining his family, to whom he wants to give a better quality of life. 

Ronald would like to buy more tools for his business, since demand has increased. For this reason he thought it best to request a loan of 1500 soles ($550) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase more tools for his metalworking business

loans.name: Hellene

texts.en: Hellene was born in 1985; she has one child who is 2 years old. Her husband is a soldier while their child hasn’t started school yet. Hellene owns a hair cutting salon which she has operated for 8 months. She is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment. In the future she plans to expand her salon and offer plaiting and hair treatments.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Ekuba

texts.en:
Ekuba M. is a Wakye seller (cooked rice and beans). This dish is normally served with pepper sauce, macaroni, boiled eggs or salad. She is married and has three children. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a farmer. 

Her business is just two years old and she wants to grow it. She is requesting a loan to buy bags of rice, beans and other things so she can cook in larger quantities to meet the demand of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekuba plans to build a better structure to sell her food in.

At the time of the visit she had finished selling for the day and is showing how she dishes out the food.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, beans and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Ryad

texts.en: Ryad is a 40 year-old married man with five children, from Sahab, Jordan. Ryad owns a grocery store and he would like to offer his customers more variety and healthy snack food choices for their children. Being the father of five children, Ryad believes in teaching children healthy eating habits to carry them into adulthood with a better quality of life and health. Ryad also knows that the summer months in Jordan can be very hot and challenging for young people. So, Ryad is requesting a loan of 1500JD to expand his selection of fresh fruits, fruit juices, fruit-flavored yogurts and sugar-free ice cream treats. Ryad aspires to expand his customer-base by incorporating a sense of sociA. responsibility into his business and treating his community with respect. Ryad also would like to increase his family income, improve their living conditions and give his children better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables for her business.

Melanie has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jacqueline Javiera

texts.es: Jacqueline Javiera tiene 34 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años, que tiene este negocio lo inicio por la necesidad de obtener un trabajo que le genere ingresos diariamente. Tiene un hijo a su cargo la lucha constante que realiza por mantener a su familia le ha permitido mejorar como persona. El motivo del crédito que realiza es para la compra de bolsos, camisas, sabanas, calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior entre otros.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Javiera is 34 years old. Her endeavor is the sale of general merchandise. It has been more than 11 years since she began this business due to her need to find work that would generate a daily income. 

She has a child under her care and she constantly fights to support her family. This has allowed her to better herself. 

The purpose for the loan she has taken out is to purchase bags, shirts, sheets, footwear, cosmetics and underwear among other things.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shirts, sheets, footwear, cosmetics and underwear among other things.

loans.name: Emerilou

texts.en:
Emerilou is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Emerilou has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.
Emerilou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emerilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks for sale

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a Ugandan male, age 27. He hails from Kyenjojo district and is the father of one child, age 3 years.

A retailer of two years, he acquired his start-up capital from farming Irish potatoes and maize.

He needs a loan to purchase sugar, salt, rice, mattresses and iron sheets to resell. 

He dreams of acquiring more land and becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt, rice, mattresses and iron sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Анвар целеустремлённый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 2 детей. Он старается, чтоб его дети выросли образованными и культурными людьми, и чтоб работали в хороших кампаниях и открыли свой собственный бизнес. Он очень хочет, чтоб его дети не знали бедности и были счастливы. С этой целью он начал заниматься купля продажей аксессуаров для мобильных более 4 лет. Анвар мечтает о том, что когда-то он расширить свой бизнес и получит максимальной прибыли. С надеждою он обратился к Имон Интернэшнл, чтобы поддерживать его и запрашивает 3000$ США. Он заранее благодарит всех, кто поддерживает его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Anvar is a goal-oriented and conscientious man. He is married and is a father of 2 children. He is doing his best to assure that his children grow up educated and cultured people, so that they can work for good companies and open their own business. Anvar wants his children to grow free of poverty and be happy. With this goal he has been managing his own mobile phone business for the last 4 years. Anvar dreams about expanding his business and maximizing his profits from it. With hope he has turned to Imon International to support him and loan him 3000 US dollars. Anvar wants to thank everyone who will support him in advance!

loans.use: to purchase new inventory

loans.name: Nuris Alicia

texts.es:
Nuris es comerciante, tiene tres años trabajando en su propio negocio, una pulperia que inicio con ahorros propios. Casada, su esposo labora como conductor de acarreo comercial, es madre de dos hijos, estudiantes de primaria.
Nuris es una mujer muy activa y como objetivo ha sido la construccion de su casa, como el apoyo  a su esposo con los gastos de alimentacion. Pues todo esta ah altos costos.
Sus ventas han aumentado al fortalecer su inventario, con prestamo que Afodenic, ha dado en seis ciclos, los cuales introdujo mas productos de consumo, y logro la captacion de mas clientes.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo, comprara: seis quintales de arroz, cinco quintales de azucar, cuatro vidones de aceite, cuatro quintale de frijoles, y golosinas. Siendo el mas vendido.
texts.en:
Nuris is a shopkeeper. She owns and works in a grocery store, which she started with her own savings 3 years ago. She is married and her husband works as a commercial driver hauling cargo. She has 2 children; both attend primary school.

Nuris is a very industrious woman. Her goal has been to build her house and to help her husband with food costs, as everything costs a lot. With the help of a loan from Afodenic, she was able to strengthen her inventory and increase sales. She did this in 6 loan cycles. During this time she introduced more consumer products and managed to attract more customers.

Now, with this new loan she is going to buy: 6 quintals (a quintal is 100 pounds) of rice, 5 quintals of sugar, 4 drums of oil, 5 quintals of beans and candy, as it is the best seller.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains to strengthen her inventory and increase sales.

loans.name: Durel Persyl

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 30 ans , célibataire sans enfant ,ayant arrete ses etudes en cours moyen elementaire a l'ecole  primaire , il se lance dans la prestation des services des jeux electroniques  en 2006 , il  ouvre une salle de jeux et a l'heure actuelle ,il a 6 postes televiseurs.
A l'otroi de son pret il va acheter  2 postes televiseurs de 14 pouces  en couleurs   et les programmes des jeux appropries et  un groupe electrogene , meme en temps coupure d'electricite de  continuer a faire fonctionner ses televiseurs et sa salle de jeux.
Il a des recettes de 6000 à 20.000 F Cfa par jour.Avec les bénéfices de son commerce, il pense épargner et à longue  ouvrir une autre salle de jeux.
texts.en: Durel is a 30 year old single man who, despite having not graduated from elementary school, began working in the electronic gaming business in 2006 by opening a game salon/room. Since the opening of his business five years ago, it has continued to grow, and he now owns six color televisions for his customers. He is asking for a loan in order to purchase two 14-inch color televisions, new electronic games and a small generator to enable his customers to continue gaming despite power outages. He earns between 6,000 and 20,000 FCA daily (approximately between 12 and 41 USD). He plans to continue saving money and hopes to open a second gaming room in the future.

loans.use: two 14 inch color televisions, new games and controllers and a small generator

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Cuenta con educación secundaria (incompleta).
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, cereales, detergentes, pastas dentales, golosinas, etc.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cincuenta arrobas de avena,  detergentes y otros productos para venderlos en la ciudad de Moquegua.  Trabaja sola  en el negocio, su esposo es transportista.
La señora desea mejorar su casa y comprar más terrenos para dejárselos a sus hijos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Marlene is a member of the “La Yunguyeñita” community bank which is located in Yunguyo district and province, in Puno department.  She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-age children.  She did not complete her secondary education.

Marlene has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business selling groceries, cereals, detergents, toothpaste, candies, etc.  

With this new loan for 1,500 soles, Marlene will buy fifty 'arrobas' of oats (1 arroba = approx. 25lbs), detergents and other products to sell in the town of Moquegua.  She works alone in her business.  Her husband is a truck driver.

Marlene would like to make improvements to her home and buy more land to leave to her children.

What Marlene likes about her community bank are the meetings and what she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy fifty 'arrobas' of oats, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Camp De Garde / Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tessito  est créé en Novembre  2006  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 17 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  MARIEANDRE,  (debout en cinquième position de la gauche vers la droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle vend des vêtements pour enfants  et des cuisses de poulet.  Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de 05 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des vêtements pour enfants en vu des les revendre durant la rentrée des classes.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et  de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire.
texts.en:
The Tessito group was created in November 2006, on the day the "banc villageois" was inaugurated. It is composed of 17 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is small-scale retailing. 

Madame  Marieandre  (standing fifth, left to right), is the leader of the group. She is 73, married and the mother of five children. She sells children's clothing and chicken thighs, as she has been doing for five years now.

With this loan she counts on buying children's clothing to sell during the back-to-school period. 

The profit from her business will permit her to put aside savings and help her husband with food expenses and school fees.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 27 years old. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her two children and husband. 

Her husband is a bricklayer. Ly earns an income by making shoes at her house. She intends to take a loan to purchase better quality materials to increase her production of shoes.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy better quality materials to increase her production of shoes.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en:
Dexter is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Dexter is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

Dexter has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Dexter hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith de 34 años de edad es una madre soltera, tiene una hija de 10 años a la que cuida como lo más preciado en su vida. Ella vive en la casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Tarma. Judith empezó su actividad económica, abriendo un pequeño negocio de abarrotes en un ambiente de su hogar. Con el tiempo se dio cuenta de que no era rentable, por la falta de capital, por esa razón acudió a sus padres, los que la apoyaron con la apertura de un restaurante. Ahora Judith lleva 3 meses en este nuevo oficio. Ahí expende una variedad de alimentos solo para la hora del almuerzo, ya que para abastecer en las mañanas, tardes y noches es necesaria una mayor inversión. De  esa manera, al día recupera lo invertido y gana de 40 a 50 soles como promedio. A la vez, ella trabajaba en una entidad estatal como recepcionista, ingresos que ayudaron positivamente en su desarrollo y el de su menor hija, pero que tuvo que dejar, por que el negocio le absorbía mucho tiempo. Judith es consciente de que, si anhela seguir creciendo, necesita de un apoyo económico, pues sus metas están claras, “quiero abrir un restaurante turístico vendiendo comida típica de la ciudad a los visitantes”, confiesa. Con su ayuda, Judith podrá acceder a su préstamo número 2 de MFP, manifiesta que será puntual y constante con sus cancelaciones. Se compromete. Ella necesita ampliar su restaurante, por tal motivo destinará el dinero en la compra de sillas y mesas; ollas, sartenes y contenedores de alimentos.
texts.en:
Judith is 34 years old and a single mother with a 10-year-old daughter that she cares for like the most precious thing in her life. Judith lives in her parents' house in the city of Tarma.

She began her economic activity by opening a small grocery store at home. In time, she noted that it wasn't profitable for lack of capital, and for this reason, she approached her parents who helped her to open a restaurant. Judith has spent the last 3 months at her new trade. She sells a variety of dishes but only during breakfast, since having supplies for mornings, afternoons and nights would require a larger investment. In this manner, Judith has recuperated her initial investment and earns 40 to 50 sols daily.

At the same time, Judith was working in a state office as a receptionist, added income that helped positively in the development of herself and her minor daughter. But she had to leave that job because her business absorbed much of her time. Judith is conscious of the fact that if she wishes to continue to grow, she needs economic assistance, because her goals are clear: “I want to open a tourist restaurant selling typical food of the city to visitors,” she explains. 

With our help, Judith will be able to obtain her 2nd loan through MFP. She promises to be punctual and constant in her payments. Judith needs to expand her restaurant, and for that purpose, she will use the money to buy chairs and tables, pots, pans, and food containers.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, pots, pans, and food containers for the expansion of her restaurant.

loans.name: Makunda Shg Group

texts.en:
Martin is the facilitator of the group Makunda SHG. His group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martin takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund’s best prices and to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Martin was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Martin will repay his loans and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Makunda SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Martin is pictured with his group members. The person standing on the far end is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La Sra. Magdalena pertenece al Banco Comunal “Consuelo”, del Distrito de San Pablo, Provincia de Bellavista y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años, y 04 hijos todos están a su cargo, el mayor  tiene 15 años estudiante del 4to de secundaria, la segunda de 11 años cursa  el sexto de secundaria, el tercero de 6 años cursa el primero de secundaria y el menor de 2 años.
Al tener pareja se dedica a la agricultura, por iniciativa se de su esposo incursiona en el negocio de salchipollo  que no le va bien , después decide incursionar en el negocio de ropa de segunda mano y actualmente lo sigue haciendo además incorporo útiles escolares, su esposo le ayuda esporádicamente. Se inicio con un capital de 300.00 nuevos soles que le brindo el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará  fardos de ropa usada para dama, caballero y niños, útiles escolares. 
La Sra. Magdalena  se considera una mujer exitosa, anhela  incrementar prendas de vestir y que sus hijos sean profesionales, está muy satisfecha con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Magdalena belongs to the communal bank “Consuelo” in the San Pablo district of the province of Bellavista and department of San Martin.  She lives with her partner, is 37 years old and has 4 children, all of whom are in her care.  The oldest is 15 years old and in his fourth year of secondary school, the second oldest is 11 and in sixth grade, the third is 6 in first grade and the youngest is 2.  

When she got married she worked in farming, an initiative her husband started in Salchipollo that didn’t go well.  Afterwards, she decided to get into the business of selling second hand clothing.  Now she keeps selling clothes and has also added school supplies.  Her husband helps occasionally.  She started with 300.00 nuevos soles given to her by Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

With this loan of 1,500.00 soles, she will buy bundles of used clothes for women, men, and children, and school supplies.

Magdalena considers herself a successful woman.  She years to increase her articles of clothing and hopes that her children will be professionals.  She is very happy with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her have opportunities to develop and move forward.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second hand clothes and school supplies.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with one six-year-old child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years she has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase men's, women's, and children's clothing. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 32 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married and has two children between the ages of 10 and 15. For the past eight years, Comfort has been selling dishes in the market, and she enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dishes to sell.  She plans to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dishes for her business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a clothes dealer. She is married and has two children; one of whom is in school. The business has been running for 6 years. She learned of Milango from her friends. 

Khadija is applying for a loan of 80,000 KES to purchase more clothes for sale. Khadija’s main challenge is price fluctuations. She looks forward to owning a big store. She will use the extra income to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Nyantiop

texts.en: Nyantiop is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. For one year, she has been selling fish in Bor, South Sudan. Nyantiop is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 33 year old man from Irbid, Jordan who helps support 6 family members. He is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to buy food products, drinks, phone credit refill cards and sodas for his store. He would like to expand his current business in this way and to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy food products, drinks and phone credit refill cards to sell

loans.name: Wanignon-Pouce 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANIGNON-POUCE 1 est composé de huit personnes qui sont dans le même village. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de  ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Christine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Christine est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Christine est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Léon. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Christine vend depuis quatre ans du vin de palme à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Christine vend également du riz. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Christine ensemble avec les membres du groupe WANIGNON-POUCE 1, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du vin de palme et du riz.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with 2 children.  He has had a motorcycle business for 5 years and it has been profitable. 

He has taken a loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase another motorcycle and hopes this will help him grow his business more.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children and have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle and hopes this will help him grow his business more

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Madam Adjoa A. is a baker of 40 year old. She is living alone with her two (02) children and four (04) other children whom she cares for. Abandoned by her husband who has been living clandestinely in Europe for more than 5 years, Madam Adjoa BLEVI courageously manages to support all her family expenditures. Having dropped out of primary school very early, she started bread selling along roads and streets. Very ingenious, she has early understood that to better succeed in life, she must be her own mistress. That is why she underwent the training in bread making. Also enterprising and very courageous, she didn’t hesitate, from her first credit to build a hard packed oven for bread making and selling. Thanks to the quality of her breads, she is more and more solicited but she is very limited by her means and cannot satisfy her clients who are getting more and more numerous. Madam Adjoa A. really induces trust through the quality of her products and especially the good management of her two credits of $ 450 and $ 650 respectively. She promptly paid reimbursed. The new credit of $ 850 in request will serve to buy the wheat flour and sugar in order to assure availability in stock as in the period of Christmas and New Year those stuffs become scarce and expensive. Surely, this credit will have a positive impact on Madam Adjoa A., because it will help her to increase her production and income to improve her socio-economic living conditions.

Madame A. Adjoa est boulangère âgée de 40 ans. Elle vit seule avec ses deux de ses propres enfants et quatre (04) personnes à sa charge. Abandonnée par son mari qui vit en clandestinité en Europe depuis plus de 05 ans, Madame A. Adjoa prend son courage à deux mains et se débrouille pas mal pour supporter toutes ces charges familiales. N’ayant pas eu la chance de terminer au moins le cours primaire, elle s’était lancé dans la vente de pain au bord des rues. Très ingénieuse, elle a compris très tôt que pour mieux réussir sa vie, il faut être maîtresse de soi-même. C’est ainsi qu’elle s’est lancée dans l’apprentissage de la fabrication du pain à l’échelle manuel. Aussi entreprenante et très courageuse qu’elle soit, elle n’a pas tardé, par son premier crédit à construire un four en terre battue pour la fabrication et la vente du pain. Aujourd’hui, de par la qualité de ses pains, elle est de plus en plus sollicitée mais ses moyens se trouvent très limités pour satisfaire sa clientèle qui, sans cesse, ne fait qu’augmenter. Madame A. Adjoa nourrit réellement confiance à travers la qualité de ses produits et surtout la bonne gestion faite de ses deux premiers respectifs de $450 et $650 obtenus et promptement remboursés. Le nouveau crédit de $850 sollicités servirons à acheter de farine de blé et du sucre afin d’assurer le stock de sécurité car en période des fêtes de noël, ces denrées deviennent très rares et très coûteux. Ce crédit aura a coup sûr un impact positif sur Madame A. Adjoa, car il lui permettra d’augmenter sa production et de facto ses revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie socio-économiques.

loans.use: to buy the wheat flour and sugar in order to assure availability in stock

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
A married mother of 6, Ms. Akossiwa S. left Vogan in 1990 to rejoin her husband in Dévémé. 46 years of age, she has been able to maintain her condiment business since her arrival in Dévémé. In fact, she has become quite well-known due to the business. Her daily work consists of going to gardens, purchasing baskets of condiments and reselling them. She is now seeking a loan of $500 to diversify into the sale of essential manufactured products and increase her purchasing power. Implementing this project will allow Ms. S. to improve her family's living conditions with the income generated by the business.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, Madame S. Akossiwa quitta Vogan en 1990 pour rejoindre son mari à Dévémé. Agée de 46 ans, elle a pu maintenir son commerce de vente de condiments qu’elle exerce depuis son arrivée à Dévémé. Cette activité fait d’ailleurs d’elle une femme bien connue. Aller dans les jardins, acheter des paniers de condiments, revenir les vendre reste son boulot quotidien. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour associer la vente des produits manufacturés de première nécessité et augmenter son pouvoir d’achat. La réalisation de ce projet pourra amener Madame Akossiwa S. à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille grâce aux revenus dégagés de son activité.

loans.use: Diversify into the sale of essential manufactured items and increase her purchasing power

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Sai and her nephew who is in grade 8 live together as a family. They have 7,000m2 of planted cashew nut trees but their productivity is very low because she has no capital for fertilizer investment. Sai sells lottery tickets to earn money for her nephew who is going to school. Their income has increased by $6 per person per month. Sai wants to borrow a loan of $50 to buy more lottery tickets to sell (if she buys them in cash she can save 10-20 cents/day) and to buy fertilizer for her cashew nut trees.

loans.use: Sai would like to buy fertilizer for cashew nut trees.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de Dios has seven years of experience in the making and sale of hammocks. Since he didn't have a job that would allow him to pay all of the household expenses, he had to start his own business. Fortunately, the quality of his products and the good service he provided have allowed him to increase sales and remain in business for all of these years. He is a very hard-working and responsible man. He is married and has two children, ages 19 and 21 respectively.

In order to increase his production and meet with his clients' demands, Juan de Dios is asking for a loan of $375. He will use the money to buy raw materials from which he will make hammocks. He commits himself to return the money within 5 months. By contributing to the development of this business, you can become an important part of Juan de Dios' life and that of his family. They would be very grateful.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan de Dios tiene siete años de experiencia en la elaboración y venta de hamacas, ante la falta de empleo para poder cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar se vio en la necesidad de emprender su negocio, afortunadamente la calidad de los productos que elabora y su buen servicio le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas y permanecer durante tanto tiempo en el negocio. Él es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 19 y 21 años de edad.

Para poder incrementar su producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Juan de Dios está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las hamacas, él se compromete regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Contribuye al desarrollo de este negocio y se parte importante en la vida de Juan de Dios y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is married and a mother of seven. Having lost her mother at an early age, she did not have the  opportunity to go to school because of lack of finances. Her husband’s meager job is not sufficient to cater for the needs of their seven children, so she had to start doing some business to support him. In 2005, she obtained her first loan of $40 with which she started the business of selling roasted fish and raised enough profits to pay school fees for her children. Given a loan of $600, she plans to open a grocery store, continue in the former business line, save some money, and continue educating her children. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery, fish, and oil

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en: Kieu and her husband plant 200 pillards of green dragon and work as day labourers to take care their two sons who are ages seven and two. Their average income is $9 per month/person. Kieu is requesting a loan of $75 to invest their green dragon planting and to develop their income. The loan will be repaid during six months.

loans.use: To invest in green dragon planting

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru:
Uguloy K. has been engaged in an enterpreneurial activity for more than 8 years. Her business is the main source of her family income. She supports six persons - her husband, two sons, daughter-in-law and two grandsons. Currently she is looking for a loan to buy wholesale and to increase the inventory.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Холбекова Угулой занимается предпринимательской деятельностью более 8 лет и ее бизнес является основным источником доходов в семье. В семье имеет 6 иждивенца (невестка , 2 внука, муж и 2 сына). На данный момент она нуждается финансовой поддержке и хочет оптом приобрести товар у оптовиков по более низкой цене.

loans.use: to increase the inventory

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora, better known in her community as Dora, is 24 years old and lives at AAHH 19 DE MAYO –LOS OLIVOS. She came to live with her family (mother and sisters) when she was still a young girl.

When she began her business she made and sold cleaning products. One year ago she opened a grocery store with which she helps her husband support their children.

Her intermediate goal is to construct a home because her current home is made of adobe. Dora has worked with EDAPROSPO since 2003 and has formed a community bank with the help of her friends.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teodora, más conocida en su comunidad como Dora, tiene 24 años viviendo en el AAHH 19 DE MAYO –LOS OLIVOS, ella vino a vivir con su familia (madre y hermanas) cuando aun era muy jovencita.

Cuando comenzó su negocio se dedicaba a la fabricación y comercialización de productos de limpieza. Desde hace 1 año, tiene una tienda de abarrotes, con lo que ayuda a su esposo a mantener a sus hijos.

Su meta a mediano plazo es construir su casa ya que en la actualidad es de adobe. Dora trabaja con EDAPROSPO desde el 2003 y llego a formar una alcancía con la ayuda de sus amigas.

loans.use: Build her house

loans.name: Norm

texts.en: Mr. Norm S., 37, is married with four children and lives with his wife in Batambong province, Cambodia. He supports his family by driving a motor-taxi and makes about $4 a day. His wife stays at home cooking and looking after the family. But Mr. S. and his wife hope to raise their family's income by using this loan to buy a stall in the local market from which she can sell a variety of fruits.

loans.use: To buy a stand in the local market from which to sell a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita M. is a baker who prepares pastries for sale. She is  divorced with 4 children. Sales are going well and she wants to increase production and to meet the demands of her customers.

She is requesting a $525 loan as an additional capital to buy more flour, sugar, margarine, oil and other ingrediants which she needs for the preparation of the pastries.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more flour, sugar, margarine, oil and other ingrediants which she needs for the preparation of the pastries.

loans.name: Hostensia

texts.en:
Hostensia M. is a widow with four children. Her difficulties in life have been that of educating her children. The worst moment came when she lost two daughters over a short period of time. These children being the eldest had the responsibility of being the breadwinner for the family. With this grate loss she was unable to provide the basic needs for the remaining children.

With the loan she plans to buy piglets, feed, medication for pigs and also plank and nails to repair and expand her pig farm. She will use part of the money to maintain one of her houses that she will give out to rent. This will help provide shelter for others and the manure will be used to cultivate her crops and improve the output. She plans to repay her loan in 24months.Her first installment will be done on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan

loans.use: Buying of piglets, feed and seedlings and repair materials

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn C. is 41 and lives in Sre Au Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is the mother of five children, two of whom work in a garment factory, while the others study in the local school. Her husband, Vin Suong, is a bed maker in the village.

Mrs. Vorn Nuon is a farmer and last year her rice field faced drought. In addition, her land was infertile. For these reasons, she decided to request a loan to buy a water pump to irrigate her rice field and to buy fertilizer to enrich the infertile field. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and fertilizer

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra P. is 35 years old and the loving mother of three children of school age. Gulchehra sells fruits and vegetables like apples, apricots, strawberries, bird-cherries, tomatoes, cucumbers and others in the central local market. She has been in this business already for 14 years. Over these years Gulchehra has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, she knows how to store the fruits so that they keep their marketable conditions and don't lose the taste and useful properties.

Being located in the biggest central market, Gulchehra's business has great clientele and is rather stable, generating the main income allowing her to support her family. Gulchehra has proved herself as an honest and reliable client. Today she requests $900 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Gulchehra plans to spend the loan to purchase fruits in order to increase the range of goods she sells. She would like to thank all for supporting her and promises to manage the current loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Gulchehra would like to purchase fruits and vegetables in order to increase the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Mercedonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Mercedonio D. P., reside en la ciudad de San Ignacio, casado, tiene 2 hijas menores; se dedica a la venta artículos de ropería y zapatería en general. El reparto de sus mercaderías lo realiza por nuestra ciudad y las zonas de Yabebyry, Laureles, Cerrito etc. para lo cual cuenta con un vehiculo.

Su esposa, Eva Rodríguez, lo ayuda en el reparto por la ciudad de San Ignacio, mediante esta actividad que posee el Sr. Mercedonio sus hijas pueden acceder a la educación de nivel medio y el bienestar de su familia.

Solicitó de este préstamo en nuestra institución para compra de camperas, calzados deportivos, tricotas de lanas específicamente debido a que posee mucha demanda en esta época D. año.

loans.use: Compra de camperas, tricotas de lana, calzados deportivos.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa Idalia arriaved to Reynosa three years ago. Her first job was helping her brother with his taco stand in the afternoon.

Time passed and she decided to begin her own business. She began selling articles for school from her home. This generated good income and with that she grew her business. Now she has a store outside of her home with a better selection for her clients. She increased her merchandise little by little in order to have a general store. With the income she makes, she has a good selection.

Now she needs a loan of $625 for 6 months to buy merchandise and paper products for the start of the school year. She has hopes that with Kiva's help she will obtain this.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Rosa Idalia llego a Reynosa hace ya 3 años, su primer trabajo fue ayudándole a su hermano atendiendo una taqueria por las tardes. Con el paso del tiempo ella decidió poner su propio negocio, inicio en su casa vendiendo artículos para la escuela, esto le generaba buenos ingresos y conforme a ellos se ha ido ampliando, ahora ya tiene un local afuera de su casa el cual lo tiene ya mas surtido con todo lo necesario para sus clientes. Y poco a poco fue surtiendo de mercancía, para tener una tienda de abarrotes, que con las ganancias que percibe pues la tiene bien surtida.

Ahora necesita de un crédito por US $625 a 6 meses, para comprar mercancía, comprar de artículos para la papelería para este regreso a clases, tiene todas las esperanzas que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores is 44 years old and lives with her two children. She is a dynamic and hard-working person, dedicated to the sale of various types of livestock including sheep, pigs and cows. The cycle of her business entails her purchasing the animals at wholesale from the market. Those which are small, she spends time feeding and fattening, a process which takes about three months. She has carried out this activity for many years, since she was 18 years old. The obstacles that can present themselves at any time are varied and include, for example, the unanticipated death of an animal which thereby reduces her working capital. For this reason, Dolores is learning how to identify signs of sickness in her livestock. Her work keeps her occupied, and she enjoys what she’s doing particularly because she knows it’s for the well-being of her children. Dolores seeks a loan to invest into her livestock, and hopes to be able to purchase additional animals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dolores tiene 44 años y vive con sus dos hijos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y dinámica, se dedica a la venta de animales, tales como ovejas, cerdos y también vacas, su dinámica de trabajo consiste en comprar animales al por mayor en la feria, aquellos que están pequeños, para que luego de un tiempo los haga engordar y mejorar, ese proceso dura en un promedio de 3 meses.Esta actividad, la viene haciendo desde hace muchos años, desde que tenía 18 años de edad. Las dificultades se presentan son cuando por razones diversas, muere uno de sus animales disminuyendo su capital de trabajo, para lo cual, Dolores está aprendiendo a identificar los signos de enfermedad de los animales. Este trabajo lo hace para mantenerse ocupada, disfruta de lo que hace porque es para el bienestar de sus hijos. Dolores solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en su ganado, de esta manera, adquirir una mayor cantidad de ellos.

loans.use: To increase the number of animals that she raises and sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in cosmetics products for her small business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 33 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 13 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Ampatiri, distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chuchito, Puno y es integrante del Banco Comunal “Buenavista” en Chacachaca.

Con un crédito inicial de S/.300 compró golosinas (galletas, chocolates, dulces). Desde los 15 años de edad empezó el negocio de golosinas. A los 20 años tuvo a su hija y dejó sus estudios porque más se dedicaba al negocio.

Con este crédito de S/.2,500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará gaseosas de toda marca por un monto de S/.2,000 y con S/.500 comprará golosinas.

Su meta es instalar un depósito de gaseosas en el Centro Poblado de Chacachaca para vender al por mayor y al por menor y que su hija estudie para ser profesional.
texts.en:
Sofia is a 33 year old single mother who finished elementary school. She has a 13 year old daughter, and she lives in the Ampatiri neighborhood in the Pomata district of the Chuchito Puno province. She is a partner in the Buenavista community bank in Chacachaca. With her first loan of 300 soles, Sofia purchased snacks (cookies, chocolates, and candies). She has worked selling snacks since she was 15 years old. Her daughter was born when she was 20, and she left school to concentrate on work. With this 2,500 sol loan which will be repaid in 3 payments,she will purchase a variety of soft drinks for 2000 soles, and while using 500 soles to purchase snacks. her goal is to open a soft drink stand in the downtown area of Chacachaca, selling in bulk and retail amounts. She also hopes that her daughter will study and become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of snaks and softdrinks.

loans.name: Hidayat Ghulam Mustafa Group

texts.en:
Hidayat baji is 47 years old, married, and the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son completed his education through 10th standard and started work as a building supervisor. Her daughters are in school.  Hidayat baji’s husband is a building contractor and provides construction materials to builders. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. Hidayat baji embroiders dresses at home and sells the in the market. Her daughters help her. She shares her earnings with her husband to meet the expenses of her household. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more construction supplies (beams, sand, and cement) for her husband. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Paveen Akhtar baji requests a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. Shabana baji requests a loan to buy another snookertable for her snooker club. Sabran baji requests a loan to buy tools for her motor workshop. ZulaiK. baji requests a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Ninoska Esperanza

texts.es:
La tienda de la señora Ninoska S. fue inaugurada desde hace 10 años por ella misma vendiendo pocos productos y en ocasiones con grandes pérdidas debido a las bajas ventas percibidas. Hoy en día ha logrado suplir su negocio gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel pasando a tener de una pequeña tiendita a una mas ampliada y con más variedad el cual es atendida en su municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.

El motivo por el cual ha buscado el refugio en Ceprodel es para la compra de la mercadería para continuar ofreciéndola en su tienda. Con el crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su  familia y de esta manera se cumplen sus sueños de mejorar en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ninoska S. started her store 10 years ago selling small products in the neighborhood of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, sometimes with large losses due to the low sales. Today she has managed to reestablish her business thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel, helping to make her small store larger with a greater variety of products. The reason she has come to Ceprodel is for the purchase of merchandise to continue offering it in her store. With the loan she will benefit, as well as her family, and be able to fulfill her dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr: Mariétou D., 19 ans est célibataire avec 01 enfant en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Château d’Eau Bignona depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut acheter des bijoux, des chaussures, des sacs et des boubous teintés pour renforcer son commerce d’effets vestimentaires et de bijoux. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariétou D. is 19 years old, single, and is responsible for one child. She has been a member of the "Château d’Eau Bignona" village bank for one and a half years. She wants to buy jewelry, shoes, bags and dyed cloth in order to bolster her clothing and jewelry business. This loan will be repaid in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry, shoes, bags, and cloth for resale.

loans.name: Valdemar

texts.en:
Valdemar is married. He and his common-law wife live in Drogobych. Valdemar sells clothing and footwear in the local market. He has been in this business for 3 years, ever since he resigned from his position of master of sports in weightlifting. Presently, Valdemar has over 100,000 Grivnas in turnover capital.

Valdemar is very industrious and enterprising – he is focused on his business and is determined to expand his vending facility. He is currently seeking a loan of 5000 Grivnas. Valdemar plans to use the loan to increase his assortment of merchandise and grow his business. With the increased sales and profits, he hopes to open an additional vending kiosk and improve the living standards of his family. We are happy to have this opportunity to assist him in his business endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean B., 37-years old, the mother of four children, and grows rice on a small rice farm with her husband, Romulo B.. They started farming 15 years ago on the 1 3/4- hectare of land they were able to buy.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for her farm. She also is planning to start a pig business, and will use part of the loan to buy piglets. This loan will help her increase her farm's yield and the pig business will increase her income.

CEVI provides credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Juan Roberto

texts.es:
Juan es socio del Bancomunal Señor De los Milagros. Juan es conviviente, tiene 32 años, y tiene tres hijos de 6, 4 y 2 que están en la escuela estatal.
Juan trabajaba en una fabrica telares él era maquinista y experto en acabados, pero lamentablemente redujeron personal y lo despidieron, estuvo buscando trabajo y no encontraba, su tía lo animo a que entrara en el negocio de recolección de reciclable, cada día sale con su moto-triciclo a comprar  fierros, papeles, para llevarlo al depósito de su tía, donde los mayoristas van a comprar.  
Desde que ingreso a Finca los prestamos le han ayudado a capitalizarse, el aprendió a ser responsable con los prestamos que pide y responsable con los pagos, las reuniones son muy agradables y son muy sociables.  
Juan necesita un préstamo de 600 soles para comprar fierros, papeles, para reciclaje 
El sueño de Juan es llegar a comprarse un carro para trabajarlo como taxi.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the "Señor de los Milagros" village bank. He lives with his spouse, is 32 years old, and has three children, ages 6, 4, and 2, who attend public school. Juan worked in a textile factory. He was a machinist and expert finisher, but unfortunately they reduced the workforce and he was laid off. He was looking unsuccessfully for work and his aunt encouraged him to get into the business of collecting recyclables. Every day he goes out with his motorized three-wheeler to buy metal and paper to take it to his aunt's collection site, where the wholesalers come to buy the materials. Since he joined Finca, the loans have helped him to capitalize his work. He has learned to be responsible with the loans that he requests and with his payments. The meetings are very pleasant and social. Juan needs to borrow 600 soles ($200) to buy metal and paper to be recycled. Juan's dream is to be able to buy himself a car to be able to operate it as a taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juan needs a loan of 600 soles ($200) to buy metal and paper to be recycled

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Confiance est constitué de quatre femmes du village de Kimparana (préfecture de San région de Ségou) qui ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3  enfants. Elles vivent dans des foyers polygames et mènent différentes activités telles  la  restauration, la  vente de condiments alimentaires  et du bois de chauffe.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Elles ont leur sixième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien  remboursés. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, du bois de chauffe, du riz et  des ingrédients nécessaires à la préparation de plats alimentaires. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de San et effectuent leurs ventes  à la maison  et au carrefour du village
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser chacune au cours du cycle  85 000FCFA. de bénéfice qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Confiance group is made up of four women from the village of Kimparana (prefecture of San, Ségou region) who are 40 on average and have 3 children. They live in polygamous households and have various businesses such as catering, selling condiments, and selling firewood.

To expand the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. They are on their 6th solidarity loan (group loan) and all the preceding loans have been reimbursed correctly.

This loan will be used to buy firewood, rice, and the necessary ingredients for preparing cooked food. They do their buying in the market in San and their sales out of their homes and at the village crossroads. With this new loan, they each expect to make 85,000 F CFA in profit during the loan cycle, money which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing rice, condiments, and firewood

loans.name: Davaadechin

texts.en:
Davaadechin S. is 27, married, and the father of one. Their son is attending kindergarten. Davaadechin’s family lives in a condominium that they own in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Davaadechin has been running a mobile phone and accessory sales business in Tedy, the biggest cellular phone sales center in Ulaanbaatar. Once every month Davaadechin goes to Beijing, China, to buy mobile phones at a cheap price to resell them in Mongolia. His wife Urantamir looks after his shop sometimes when he goes to Beijing. Besides helping her husband, Uranchimeg runs her own grocery store.

Davaadechin requests a loan to buy more mobile phones to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Otunoy

texts.ru: Отуной женщина, которая торгует обувью для мужчин, женщин и детей. Она имеет стаж в этом бизнесе более 7 лет.Хочет получить повторно кредит и поехать за товаром в Истаравшан.У Отуной осталось много на сезонного ассортимента обуви , зимних тапочек.Поэтому ей необходимо пополнить товар летним ассортиментом обуви.Отуной благодарит инвесторов за понимание и финансирование.
texts.en:
Otunoy is a woman who sells men's, women's and children's shoes. She has more than seven years of experience in this business. She wants to take out another loan and go to Istaravshan for merchandise. Otunoy still has many of not seasonal winter shoes. This is why she needs to get new merchandise with summer assortment of shoes. Otunoy is very thankful to the lenders for their understanding and support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer assortment of shoes

loans.name: Sarly

texts.en: Mrs. Sarly has a tune-up shop for automobiles that she and her husband, Jorge S., run. They have a good clientele as they are the only ones in the area that work in this field. She is 44, married and has two children. They are from the city of San Estanislao. Mrs. Sarly’s project is to open another branch of their business downtown so they can improve their service to their clients.

loans.use: For business capital

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
DOLORES M. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES CON FUTURO”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Apurímac Nº 409, tiene 63 años de edad, un hijo mayor y su esposo es pescador.

Tiene 10 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, el cuál lo utilizó para comprar combustible y redes para luego ir a pescar junto a su esposo. En la actualidad ella compra y vende sabanas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500. Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en el arreglo de una máquina de coser y comprará materiales para confeccionar y diseñar sabanas.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad le otorgó un crédito mientras que Manuela sin tanto papeleo, confía en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Dolores M. M. belongs to the Communal Bank “Women with a Future”; she is 63 years old, has one older child, and her husband is a fisherman. She has been with Manuela Ramos for 10 years, and the first loan that she acquired was of 300 PEN, which she used to purchase fuel and fishing nets to fish with her husband. Currently she purchases and sells sheets. With this loan of 1,500 PEN, she will invest in fixing a sewing machine and will purchase materials to make and design sheets. She is thankful for Manuela Ramos, because no other entity ever granted her a loan, while Manuela Ramos, without a great deal of paperwork, believes in her and motivates her to be responsible in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make sheets.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo is a simple farmer in the village of Darubba Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. His family lives happily in the village despite their poor living situation. He is married to Charity and they were blessed with four children, who are all presently studying in high school and elementary school. With their desire to uplift their living conditions, Guillermo and his wife work hand in hand to earn enough income for their family. 

The couple help each other in maintaining their farm lot in the upland. They plant vegetables, root crops, rice and some fruit trees. Guillermo is seeking financial capital in order to sustain their supply of needed farm inputs for the maintenance of his crops. He would like to borrow a loan of PHP12,000 that he will use for his farm. He is so glad that every month, he can generate an average income of PHP4,000 from his vegetables, root crops and fruits, which is enough to support the school allowances of their children and their family needs.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth C., 54, has been involved in a business of selling beans with a typical income of US $1.66 per day in Takeo Province since 2008. C. and her husband work very hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for the family. Her husband and C. are blessed with four children; two of them are enrolled in a local high school while the other two are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is a motorbike repairman in the town with a typical income of US $5 per day.

C. really wants to take out a loan of US $600 to purchase motorbike and bicycle spare parts to have on hand to replace parts for her husband’s customers’ motorbikes and bicycles when theirs get broken. By doing this, she hopes that she will be able to generate a better income to cover her family expenses as well as for savings to support her children’s future education.

loans.use: motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Martha De La Cruz

texts.es: La Señora Martha de la Cruz Alonso A. tiene 48 años de edad. Sus 2 hijos trabajan de manera independiente. Es una Señora muy luchadora y tiene un espíritu muy alegre. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que su esposa trabajaba en una empresa pero debido a ciertas circunstancias tuvo que ir a la guerra, y murió y con la ayuda de la familia logro salir adelante con este pequeño negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, detergente, jabón y golosinas en general. Su deseo es seguir apoyando a sus hijos, ya que ella es madre y padre al mismo tiempo.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha de la Cruz Alonso A. is 48 years old. Her two children work independently. This woman is a fighter, yet possesses a very cheerful spirit. She spends her time operating a grocery store and has been in business for 6 years. Sra. Martha’s husband was a company employee before he was drafted to fight in battle and eventually died in combat. With the support of her family, she was able to move forward with this small business.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy basic grains, detergent, soap, candy, and other general items. She hopes to continue supporting her children, since she has to be a mother and a father at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Назаров Рачабали проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Рачабали более 3 лет занимается откармливанием и продажей скота. Кредит просит для закупа скота и увеличения товараборота, т.к. этот вид бизнеса является единственным источником дохода.

loans.use: Покупка скота

loans.name: Aquila

texts.en:
Aquilia L. is 37 years old, is married and has four children. She is into a hog-raising business, which she hopes to make bigger. She is like any mother who wants her family to be happy.

A member of CEVI for more than a year now, Aquilia particularly likes the low interest rate. She is now requesting a loan of Php 8,000 which will be used to buy feed and piglets to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and feed

loans.name: Marissa
