texts.en: Mrs. Marissa P. is 28  years old residing at Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga, Mis.Occ. She is married and blessed only with 1 child who is still an infant. She  joined PMPC on April 17, 2009 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she's accessing her 2nd loan in the amount  of  PHP 1,500 for  additional working capital of   her  existing  business which is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: Additional working capital for snack-vending and other food products in the local community

loans.name: Mario Filadelfo

texts.es: Mario Filadelfo P. P. de 53 años de edad  reside en el departamento de La Libertad con su esposa y sus dos hijas de 14 y 16 años de edad. Mario y su esposa hace nueve años se aventuraron a emprender un negocio, ya que el sueldo de Mario no alcanzaba para los gastos familiares y fue así como esta pareja de esposos inicio con un pequeño comedor el cual ahora se ha convertido el favorito de muchos, por los exquisitos platillos y precios muy accesibles, ahora el comedor de Mario es muy transcurrido, razón por la cual solicita de un crédito que le permita aumentar su volumen de producción.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para la elaboracion de comida

loans.name: Handatu

texts.en: Handatu is 32 years old. She is married and a mother of two children. All of her children are in school. Her family is doing very well, and she is so happy about that. Vida is in the service industry, sewing dresses as a seamstress. She has been sewing for two years and is a specialist in lady wears. Her skills and designs are unique. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, clothing such as; children school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit wedding dress, funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to increase her supplies of sewing material like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings and provide her children with quality education. She would be grateful for your assistance and support.

loans.use: To increase supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to improve her output and efficiency

loans.name: Micaela Isabel

texts.es: Doña Micaela tiene 51 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Cortes Típicos”, habita junto  a sus Papas, ella se dedica en la venta de ropa Típica, llevan  8  años de vender,   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  la Planta  del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella  pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
“Venta de Cortes Típicos” (Typical Garment Sales) Micaela, 51, is a single merchant. She lives with her parents and, for the past 8 years, has sold typical clothing. She lives in Paraje la Planta, Poxlajuj territory, Totonicapán department and municipality, Guatemala. Currently, demand from her customers has increased but her financial state is insufficient for her to increase capital to meet demand. For this reason she called upon Asociación ASDIR to request a loan which will be used to buy raw materials to increase sales hoping, as well, to see her family get ahead and have improved living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
La señora Gloria M., con gran ahínco se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de frutas como manzanas, bananos, naranjas, jocotes, mangos, melones, entre otros ofrecidos en su establecimiento todas las mañanas desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Ella se ha esforzado grandemente por buscar la manera de salir adelante y así mejorar las condiciones de su actividad.
Ella es madre soltera y con dos hijos a los que debe pagar sus estudios por ser menores de edad, el crédito lo solicita para comprar las frutas y de esta manera continuar vendiéndolas en su localidad en el mercado central de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Señora Gloria M. diligently attends to her business selling fruits such as apples, bananas, oranges, jocotes, mangos, and melons. Her establishment is open every morning from the very early hours of the morning. She has worked very hard to look for a way to get ahead and improve the conditions of her business. She is a single mother with two children who must pay for their schooling, since they are minors. She is requesting a loan to buy fruit, so that she can continue her sales from her stall in the central market of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Chroek

texts.en: Chroek S. is a 43 years old and lives in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She was married, but divorced her husband years ago. She has two children who are not longer in school and currently work sewing clothes for a garment industry. Chroek S. earns her daily income by providing a small loans with stable repayment schedules to people who are her neighbors in the village. The family’s living situation is difficult since their house is old and needs repair. Because of that, Chroek S. requests a loan of $350 to be used to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Celia Marleny

texts.es: Celia Marleny G. D. M. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en Rosario D. La Paz, ubicado en el departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como conserje y junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una pupusería en su propia casa, así mismo venD. bebidas frías y calientes. Celia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz en mayores cantidades, ya que este el ingrediente principal D. las pupusas, así mismo comprar queso, frijoles y más bebidas. Celina desea mejorar las ventas D. su negocio ya que ha sido a través D. este como durante años le ha brindado la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para poder seguir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Celia Marleny G. D. M. is 45 and lives in Rosario D. La Paz, which is located in the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who works as a caretaker of a building, and their three young children, who go to school. She has a pupusería [a store where pupusas or sold, which are corn tortillas stuffed with beans, cheese, and/or meat] in her home. She also sells cold and hot drinks. Celia is requesting a loan so she can buy corn in large quantities, since this is the main ingredient in pupusas, as well as cheese, beans, and more drinks. Celia hopes to improve the sales of her business since through it, she has been able to give her husband the necessary help to take good care of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and drinks

location.town: Rosario de La Paz, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Mukimjon

texts.en:
K. Mukimjon is 39 years old. He buys and sells cattle from different market places and has been in the business for the last 12 years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. He is requesting a fourth loan after successfully repaying the third one. With the previous loans, Mukimjon has been able to increase on the number of head that he trades. 

Mukimjon is married and a father of three children. With the loan from Kiva, he plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He plans to see his children go through higher education and be able to get good jobs unlike himself.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more head of cattle

loans.name: Petronilla Ajiambo

texts.en: Petronilla Ajiambo M. is 65 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She lives in Manyole, Busia district. Petronilla has a business trading in cereals. She started this business in the year 2006 as a source of income generation. She would like a loan of 10,000 KES, which she will use to expand her stock base of cereals such as maize, green grams, etc.

loans.use: To expand her stock of cereals

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita L. is from the village of Upper Lamac in Oroquieta City. She is 44 years old. Perlita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells different products such as canned goods, candies, biscuits and soy sauce in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Perlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Perlita's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram Y. is 38 years old and he lives in Ijevan city. He is married and has a son and two daughters. 
Since 2000, Aram has been engaged in the shoe trading business in a rented place in Ijevan City Market Centre. At the same time, Aram and his father make shoes to order and per month, they produce approximately 50 pairs of shoes.
Aram has taken a loan three times from “Nor Horizon” and has never been delinquent in his repayments.
Aram asks for a loan of 500,000 AMD to buy spring shoes to resell.

loans.use: To buy spring shoes to resell

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Mr. Bora K. (was in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Sarath Nao, live in a small village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1986 and have five children; one son and four daughters. All of them study in a local school.

Bora and his wife have been selling fish for more than 15 years. They buy fish from Prek Phnao market at Pon Nhea Loeu district for resale at a market in Phnom Penh. He is requesting his second loan of $1,200 to continue expanding his business of buying fish for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie V. is 56 years old and lives in Brgy Villareal, Bayawan City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living through her general store, eatery and furniture business.

Rosie’s partner, Jessie, is 63 years old and is a consultant.  They have 3 adult children aged between 27 and 33 who are currently working and help their parents with some of the family expenses.

Rosie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by operating her business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000.

Rosie is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 16,000 was used to fund her business operations and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 6th loan of Php 20,000 which she intends to use on her general store, eatery and furniture business. Rosie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: to provide additional working capital

loans.name: Lucy Nzai Kirao

texts.en:
34-year-old Lucy is a mother of seven children and married to a hotelier. She is in the retail and green grocery business, selling fruits, vegetables and soft drinks, sugar, etc. to local residents at Sabaki area in Malindi. The ten-year-old business now earns her a monthly profit of Kshs 5,400. 

Lucy was introduced to Kadet by an existing member and this is her second loan. This loan will enable her to renovate her shop with Kshs 2,000 while the rest will buy retail stock like flour and sugar, etc. The extra income from this loan will enable her to expand business and pay school fees for her children. A hard-working woman, she plans on saving for her children’s education and owning rental houses.

loans.use: Rennovate shop and expand inventory

loans.name: Segundo Fausto

texts.es:
Segundo Fausto P. G.  tiene 66 años, es casada,  tiene  8 hijos que se llaman Beatriz de 40, Rosalía de 38,  Guadalupe de 35, Agnelio de 32, Laura de 28, Francisco de 22, Anita de 21 y Manuel de 18 de  años  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Segundo trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, trigo, cebada, papas, habas arbeja, fréjol.   Vende los productos en el cantón de San Miguel. 
Segundo solicita el crédito para comprar ureas, abonos y para el mejoramiento de la vivienda.  Su meta es  que sus cultivos den buenos productos para mejorar los precios y su comodidad en su vivienda.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son que en tiempo de cosechas los precios se ponen muy bajos. Segundo manifiesta que en su comunidad celebran a San Francisco y  cuando no hay mucho trabajo salen a pasear en conjunto de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Fausto P. G. is 66 years old, married, and has eight children named Beatriz (age 40), Rosalía (age 38), Guadalupe (age 35), Agnelio (age 32), Laura (age 28), Francisco (age 22), Anita (age 21), and Manuel (age 18). They live in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar.

Segundo is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba”. The group consists of 25 members, most of whom are engaged in agriculture. Segundo has been farming all of his life as the main source of income for his family. Among the crops grown in the area are corn, wheat, barley, potatoes, lima beans, peas, and kidney beans. He sells his products in San Miguel Canton.

Segundo is requesting a loan to buy urea and compost, as well as make improvements to his home. His goals are to improve his crops so that he can gain the best price and make his home more comfortable. Segundo’s challenges include dealing with low market prices during harvest time. He says that he and his family celebrate with the rest of the community of San Francisco whenever there is not much work left to be completed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase urea & compost; make improvements to his home

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad O. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 64 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Caridad owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Caridad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Caridad is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky B., 36, is making sure that his family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Marie Sera B., 36, a housewife, they are blessed with two children. Ricky makes sure that he helps his wife so that their family can have a better life. He has been managing his own junk shop business for quite some time now.
Ricky has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance for previous loans, he has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. He is consistent in paying his dues because he used the money he borrowed to expand and improve his junk shop.
To ensure the success of his business, he would like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to help expand his business by buying more junk items to sell to a bigger junk shop. Ricky dreams that his business will continue to grow so that he can provide for his children’s education. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy junk items (e.g. plastics, cans, bottles, papers, cartons) for resale

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela L. C., tiene 61 años de edad vive en el Barrio de San Caralampio, ubicado en el humilde Municipio de la Concepcion, con su esposo y sus hijos que le apoyan en los trabajos del hogar, se dedica desde hace 18 años a la agricultura sobre todo de frutos cítricos, su hijo mayor de edad, es el único casado que se dedica al comercio, y apoya a su madre a los gastos económicos que se incurren en el diario vivir de la señora L..

Dentro de los principales problemas que ha acogido a la señora a lo largo de su carrera de siembra, son las plagas y las enfermedades que han obstaculizado en gran medida la producción de los frutos , es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales fertilizantes, fungicidas y otros que permitan un mejor mantenimiento de las tierras para el buen mantenimiento de sus cosechas, esta inversión le permitirá mejores condiciones económicas para la inversión en la reparación de su morada y a futuro heredársela a sus hijos o bien para la inversión o incursión a nuevas fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Ángela L. C. is 61 years of age and lives in the Neighborhood of San Caralampio, located in the humble Municipality of Concepcion, with her husband and their children who support her in the family work. She has been dedicated for 18 years to agriculture, mostly of citrus fruits. Her son of legal age is the only married child that is dedicated to commerce, and he supports his Mother with the economic expenses that are incurred in the daily life of Señora L.. Among the main problems that she has experienced in her work are the plagues and diseases that have hindered in great measure the production of the fruit. It is for this reason that she requests a loan for the purchase of fertilizer, fungicides and other materials that provide better maintenance of the lands for the good maintenance of her crops. This investment will provide better economic conditions for repairing her dwelling and in the future to pass on to her children or also to invest or explore new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, fungicides and other materials to improve the production of her crop of citrus fruits.

loans.name: Osman Antonio

texts.es:
Osman de 38 años de edad es soltero, tiene 2 hijos: Alexander de 16 años y Ercka de 14 ambos estudiando la secundaria. Osman trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 21 años, desempeñandose como  conductor. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto y asi poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, ya que actualmente comparten el cuarto con sus padres.   

El mayor sueño que Osman tiene es que sus hijos estudian y sean personas de bien, ademas poder tener una vivienda bonita y con las condiciones que su familia necesita.
texts.en:
Osman, 38, is single and has two children: Alexander, 16, and Ercka, 14, both of whom attend high school. Osman has been working at the Juigalpa City Hall for the last 21 years as a driver. Osman will use his first loan to build an addition to the home in which he lives. He'd like to build this addition so that he and his family, who now share a room with his parents, are more comfortable. Osman's dream is that his children will study and be good people, and that they will have a nice home, and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building an addition to his home

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane Z. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 48 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting varieties of rice for sale like "masipag", "74", "70" and more. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mary Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eleventh loan taken out by Mary Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is now widowed with four children and two of her children go school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

Ruth owns a stall selling charcoal and foodstuffs and has been in this business for many years. She buys bags of charcoal from delivery vans which get them from villages, and foodstuffs from Kasubi market. She uses public transport to and from Kasubi. Besides this charcoal business she also sells piped water.

Ruth works from her home and sells retail, working six days a week. Her business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to see her business grow big and to start going directly to farmers and producers.

Ruth decided to work with MCDT because it is helping low-income women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal and bags of cassava, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and bags of cassava, potatoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Sokhai

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhai I, (in the photo), age 46, has been married to Mr. Po I, age 53, since 1979. They have six children: two sons and four daughters. Five of them are garment factory workers and another one is a monk. The family is living in a small village along National Road Number Five, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhai has been selling groceries at her home for six years. She buys grocery items from Prek Phnao market. Her husband assists her in the business. She does not have her own transportation, so traveling costs her a lot of money. 

Therefore, Sokhai is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi, aged 50 years, is a married man with seven children who lives in a permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He wants his children to study and have their own stable income.

Saidi deals in cattle. He wants a loan to buy more cattle to resell at a profit.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to resell at a profit

loans.name: Agustín

texts.es: El Sr. Agustín C. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como recolector de basura en la Alcaldía de dicho municipio donde tiene cuatro años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en ceprodel con el objetivo de comprar dos puertas para su vivienda.
texts.en: Agustín C. is from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón. He currently works as a garbage collector for the city, a job he has been doing for four years. This is the first loan he has requested from field partner CEPRODEL. The purpose of the loan is to purchase two doors for his home.

loans.use: Purchase two doors for his home.

loans.name: Iniciadoras Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama INICIADORAS, porque entre todas las integrantes se motivaron a iniciar con el grupo. Está ubicado en México. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes.L. señora Reyna A. es integrante D. este grupo. Tiene 49 años, estudio hasta S. D. secundaria, es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos, 3 mujeres y 1 hombre, dos dependen D. D. elL.. ElL. lleva viviendo en L. comunidad 2 años y se dedica a L. venta D. tortillas y abarrotes, esta actividad L. inicio hace 9 años, el crédito lo solicita para comprar maíz, gas y abarrotes. Con un préstamo L. señora compró su tanque, comal y prensa para hacer las tortillas, con esto elL. se motivo a seguir adelante con su negocio.Sus clientes comenta que las tortillas que venD. L. señora están bien hechas y les inspira confianza el comprarlas porque tiene L. confianza D. llevarse un producto D. calidad. Al solicitar este préstamo L. señora Reyna se siente motivada y comprometida a seguir trabajando para poder cumplir con sus metas. Quiere este crédito para obtener más producción, consolidar su negocio y ayudar a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
This group is called “Iniciadoras” (Initiators) because the members were motivated to start the group.  The group is located in Mexico.  It is comprised of 12 members.

Reyna A. is a member of this group.  She is 49 years old, and she went to school until the second year of high school.  She is married and has a total of four children, three girls and a boy.  Two of the children are dependent upon her.  She has been living in the community for two years.  She sells tortillas and groceries, an activity she started nine years ago.

The loan she is requesting is to buy corn, gas, and groceries.  She used a loan to buy a gas tank, a “comal” (ceramic dish or metal hotplate for cooking tortillas), and a press for making tortillas.  This motivated her to get ahead with her business.  Her customers say that the tortillas that Reyna sells are well maD..  This inspires confidence in buying them because the customers know they are getting a quality product.

Upon requesting this loan Reyna feels motivated and committed to continue working in order to be able to reach her goals.  She wants this loan in order to increase production, strengthen her business, and help her children finish their education.

loans.use: To buy raw material and invest in her business

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Planting rice has been Enriquita C.' livelihood. She is from Banga, South Cotabato. She never stops dreaming that someday she will be a successful businesswoman and she will be able to buy her family an adequate supply of food, clothes and other basic needs.

She would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds. The loan will hopefully help her improve her harvest. The income will be used to support her family and her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ross Mery

texts.es: Ross Mery, de 32 años, está casada con Juan Carlos, de 32 años, ambos tienen un hijo, de 3 años de edad, al que educan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Kivinaki. Hace 3 años, que viene administrando la botica de su tío, el cual por motivos de viaje, confió el cuidado de su establecimiento. El cual según Ros Mery, le ofrece buenas utilidades, ya que en la zona es la única que se dedica a este servicio. Sin embargo, ella; desea tener algo propio; del cual pueda sentirse orgullosa, siendo su principal cualidad la “dedicación y empeño”. Por ello está juntando algo de dinero, para abrir, un restaurante, en la zona comercial de la ciudad de Pichanaki; ya que está segura de su éxito, ahí ofrecerá platos típicos de la selva peruana, ya que es muy solicitada entre los visitantes y turistas. Ross Mery, es honesta y muy responsable; no solo con las cuotas de MFP, también en las reuniones de su banco comunal. Ya es el tercer crédito que  tienen y, se siente orgullosa de los logros obtenidos. Con el crédito que obtendrá podrá, surtir su botica, con medicamentos nuevos y repondrá los ya vendidos; con mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
Ross Mery is 32 years old.  She is married to Juan Carlos who is also 32 years old.  They both have a 3 year-old son who they are educating and raising in their own home which is in the town of Kivinaki.  She has been running her uncle's drugstore since he went away on a trip and left her in charge of the establishment.  The store, according to Ros Mery, offers her good profits since it she is the only one in the district who offers this service.  However, she would like to have something of her own which she can feel proud of since her main qualities are “dedication and determination”.  For this reason she is gathering together some money to open a restaurant in the commercial district of the city of Pichanaki since she is sure of its success.  There she will offer traditional dishes of the Peruvian jungle.  They are very much in demand with visitors and tourists.

Ross Mery is honest and very responsible not only with her MFP repayments but also in the meetings of her community bank.  This is the third loan which she has had and she feels proud of what she has achieved.  She will use her loan to stock her drugstore with new medicines and replace those which she has already sold in greater quantity.

loans.use: To stock her drugstore with new medicines and to replace those which she has already sold

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya.  She is married with four children between the ages of four and eleven years old.  She has been doing mixed farming for five years, selling her produce of eggs, beans, maize and bananas locally.

She has applied for a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  She reckons it will provide enough milk for the family and generate stable income for basic needs like clothing and school fees.  She foresees herself having a vehicle to transport her produce to the market.

Josphine's challenge are low market prices coupled with animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude M. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of an additional family member (orphan).

Gertrude has a business of tailoring. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Gertrude sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Gertrude has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of African attire and clothing materials. She also generates additional income through bridal dresses.

The main business challenge(s) for Gertrude include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal shop.   Gertrude lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of African attire and clothing materials.

loans.name: Elaine Joy

texts.en:
Elaine Joy A. is from the village of Brgy. Paungan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 23 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Elaine Joy owns & operates a vegetable selling business. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elaine Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support her immediate family members. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson S. is 51 years old. He is married to Ruth S. and blessed with eight children. He has had a mixed farm for the last twenty years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for mixed farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan with which he is planning to buy farm supplies. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his grand children.

His hope and dream is to educate his children and re-invest in the farm. Wilson is a conscientious man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Suhbat

texts.en:
Suhbat, 30, is married and lives with his wife and a four-year-old son in a small village in Mongolia. They live in their own winter house. He started his car repair service in 2003. His workshop operates 24 hours a day and it is a busy place as the village is located by the main road between the capital city and the western provinces of Mongolia. He is a hard-working and active person who has enough technical knowledge end experience to run the business successfully. 

Suhbat wants to enlarge the workshop and upgrade his service. In that way, he hopes to  have more regular customers in the future. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy more spare parts that are useful for his workshop.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley C. is from the village of Bacnor West, Burgos, Isabela. She is 49 years old. Shirley is married and has seven school-aged children. 

To make a living, Shirley owns and operates a general store. Shirley has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Shirley joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Shirley is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Shirley from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jenny Amparo

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jenny, ella tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 17 y 16 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en Universidad y el menor en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene una despensa de viveras de consumo, vende productos  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 23h00, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo y algunos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que por esta época son muy buenas las ventas por la época de carnaval ya que muchos turistas llegan a vacacionar por toda la temporada playera.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son tener un negocio más grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the Communal Bank "Esperanza Para Superar" (The Hope To Go Beyond) meet in the splendid seaside resort of San Jacinto, surrounded by a lovely beach where the River Portoviejo meets the sea. The resort is visited by many tourists, locals and foreigners alike.

Here we met Señora Jenny, 44 years old and married. From this union she has two sons. The elder son is 17 and studies at the university, and the younger is 16 and is in secondary school. Her husband is a farmer.

She has a grocery store and sells products such as rice, sugar, oil and detergents, among others. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. and her sons and her husband help her. She buys her inventory in downtown Portoviejo and sometimes goods are delivered to her store. She told us that currently she has a good turnover at the carnival season, because at this time many tourists spend their vacation at the beach.

This loan will be used to stock up her grocery. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other staples. She has had four loan cycles from the Communal Bank and likes it because she made friends with other group members. Her goal is to have a larger store and that her children become professional workers.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, oil, detergents, sausages and other staples

loans.name: Nancy Maribel

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo aún a su cargo. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 10 años, Nancy cuenta con una bodega donde vende a sus vecinos abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Es muy conocida en el mercado y cuenta con una clientela establecida y fidelizada. 

Desea invertir su crédito en su negocio para comprar más mercadería. Espera aumentar su margen de utilidad para seguir cuidando a su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 900 nuevos soles. Nancy es muy trabajadora y responsable y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.  Ha solicitado préstamos a Edpyme en el pasado y siempre cumplió con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old, single and has one son still in her care. She lives in her own house in the Motupe district, a farming area in Lambayeque province, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 10 years, Nancy has had a store where she sells groceries and basic necessities to her neighbors. She is well-known in the market and has an established and loyal customer base. 

She wants to invest her loan in her business in order to buy more merchandise. She hopes to increase her profit margin in order to continue caring for her family. Therefore, she thought it advisable to request a loan of 900 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Nancy is very hardworking and responsible, and has good personal and work-related references. She has requested loans from Edpyme in the past and always met her obligations in a punctual manner.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles de 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pulpería. Trabaja en la tienda todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Hace más de tres años comenzó con su negocio desde ese tiempo ha continuado con esfuerzo y dedicación para mantenerla con un nivel de ventas optimo para los ingresos de su familia. Vende arroz, azúcar, bebidas, detergentes, refrescos, pan, sopas y enlatados. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo víveres. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Angeles, age 30, is a hardworking woman who has a store. She works every day from 6am to 10pm. Maria started this business more than three years ago and has continued to work with effort and dedication to maintain an optimal sales level so that her family will have income. She sells rice, sugar, beverages, detergents, soft drinks, bread, soups, and canned goods.

Maria has many aspirations for her business. For this reason, she will use this loan to buy provisions. In the future, she wants to have a well-stocked store.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beverages, detergents, soft drinks, bread, soups, and canned goods.

loans.name: Ana Esther

texts.es: Ana tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de tres años de edad. Los tres viven en casa propia en el distrito de San José ubicada en la provincia de Pacasmayo en el norte de Perú. Ana se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral (pavos, patos, y gallinas). Los corrales están ubicados en una parte de su casa. Cuando los animales ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende en el mercado local. Tiene tres años de experiencia en este rubro. Ana tiene la oportunidad de comprar más patos a precios de ocasión. Desea usar su crédito para realizar estas compras. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
24-year old Ana is married and has a 3-year old daughter. The family lives in their own house in San José district, Pacasmayo province, in the north of Peru. Ana raises poultry (ducks, turkeys, and chickens) in a part of her house. When they have reached a good size and weight, she sells them in the local market. She has three years’ experience doing this work.

Ana now has the opportunity to buy more ducks on sale so she has approached Edpyme Alternativea (Kiva field partner) for a loan of 1000 soles to make these purchases.

Ana thanks Kiva donors for their support in helping her expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise and sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María Díaz Díaz, vive en ajilho municipio de bochil Estado de Chiapas.  Vive en unión libre con el señor Maximiliano Gómez  Hernández, con quien procreo  a una hija de nombre Marisa  María Belén de tan sólo tres años de edad.
   
   El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de pollos  de granja para venderlo aliñado  (destazado) y asado en la misma localidad, en donde comenzó a practicarlo hace unos meses  y está contenta porque se vende bien  ya que los tiene a buen precio que a la gente le interesa comprar.

    Por su propia creatividad decidió trabajar, para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar, a si solventar deudas que se han generado para salir adelante.

     Su deseo es trabajar con el préstamo para agrandar su venta de pollos y así estar pendiente de su pequeña familia que es los mas importante para ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Díaz Díaz lives in Ajilho in the town of Bochil, in the state of Chiapas.  She lives with her partner, Mr. Maximiliano Gómez Hernández, and their daughter, Marisa María Belén, who is three years old.

She plans to use the loan to buy farm-raised chicken to grill and sell in her village.  She began the business a few months ago and is happy because it is going so well because her prices are low and many people are interested in what she sells.

The decision to start the business was her own idea since she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses so they could pay off debt and get ahead.

She hopes to be able to expand business with the loan so she can continue to take care of her small family, which is what is most important to her.

loans.use: To buy chicken for retail sale

loans.name: Zebikhon

texts.ru: Исмоилова Зебихон проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Её муж занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама Зебихон более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. В основном она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Zebikhon I. lives in Vahdat. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a day laborer working in construction.  Zebikhon has been working in animal husbandry for more than ten years. She raises cattle at home. She primarily fattens and sells cattle. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Panai

texts.en:
Panai is 30 years old.  He is married to Carol and they have two children.  He has been farming on his piece of land for the past five years.

Panai has applied for his fourth loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals.  He has been a good client.  He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm.

Panai dreams of prospering in farming and being able to provide better lives for his children.

loans.use: purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Teophile

texts.en:
Teophile is 45 years old and has four children aged four to twenty-one years old.

For the past four years Teophile has been rearing animals such as goats to sell, as well as selling eggs and sorghum. It has enabled her to feed and educate her children.

Teophile is requesting a loan to buy more goats and chickens. She plans to pay school fees for her children with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy goats and chickens.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito, 46, is a married man with two children aged 21 and 14.

Anecito is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. He grows rice crops to sell. Anecito works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, he hopes to improve his farming and build a better house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Félix Benjamín

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Félix Benjamín es casado y  se dedica arduamente  a laborar como promotor comunitario en una institución estatal desde hace 4 años. Persona que se ha caracterizado  por ser trabajador, responsable, con buenos valores y principios  morales. 

Se presento ante esta oficina  de  Ceprodel para solicitar crédito, para mejorar la  condición de su vivienda en levantar una pared que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que ha tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra  de mejora, con este desembolso comprare los materiales de construcción tales como bloque, arena, cemento, estribo, hierro y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Félix Benjamín is from the city of Managua. He is married and he has been working very hard as a community facilitator for a government institution for 4 years. He has shown himself to be hardworking and responsible, with good values and moral principles. 

He came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan to improve the condition of his house by repairing a wall that has been in poor condition. He has made the wise decision to improve it. With this loan he will buy construction materials such as cement block, sand, cement, wooden supports, and rebar, and also pay for labor.

loans.use: to improve his house.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth, 38, runs a cake business. She is married to Paulus, a 49 year old fisherman. Their marriage has been blessed with six children. They are: 
- Amelia, 21, who is married and lives with her husband 
- Rosmiati,15, in third grade of junior high school 
- Ariel, 10, in sixth grade of elementary school 
- Stevani, 8, in third grade of elementary school 
- Olan, 6, in first grade of elementary school
- Mona, 2, who is not yet at school

Elisabeth has been running her cake business for one year to support her husband in generating income for their family. Elisabeth recognized that she needs more money to support her family. Paulus has an idea for Elisabeth to create a net for fishing to sell, as Elisabeth has the skills to do it. The idea came about when a friend of Paulus had a problem with his net and he couldn’t afford to buy a new one. Paulus and Elisabeth plan to sell the net created by Elisabeth at an affordable price for the fishermen around them.

To implement the plan, Elisabeth needs money. She is requesting a loan of 7,500,000 IDR from TLM. She plans to spend the loan on rope, string, balancing floats and other supplies to make the net. Elisabeth hopes that her loan application will be approved.

loans.use: to buy rope, string, balancing floats, and other equipment to make a fishing net.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is 30 years old and a single mother of one child. Joselyne lives in a family house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For five years, Joselyne has been operating a poultry project. Her dream is to expand her poultry business and some day build her own home. Joselyne's main challenge is the high cost of feed. Joselyne would like to own at least 2,000 birds; she currently has 100. Joselyne is requesting this loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Sadafmo

texts.ru:
Садафмо трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она вдова и любящая мать 4 детей. Когда её муж покинули их, им было, очень трудно смерится с этим трудным незабываемым испытание жизни. Она думала, как зарабатывать деньги, чтобы кормит своих детей. Она решила, что купля продажей фрукты и овощи даст ей хороший прибыль и более 16 лет она занимается этим. Её дети помогает ей, и они купили автомашину для перевозкой продуты. Она хотела бы получит займ в размере 2300$ США для покупки бахчевых культур. Она надеется, что кредиторы будет поддерживать её. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Sadafmo is a hardworking and conscientious woman. She is a widow and a loving mother of 4 children. When her husband passed away it was very hard for her family to come to terms with the cruel turn in their lives. Sadafmo worried how to make enough money to feed her children. She decided that selling fruits and vegetables at the market would provide enough income for her family and has been successful in this business for the last 16 years. Her children help her out as well and they purchased a car for easier transport of the produce from the farms to the market. Currently Sadafmo would like to take out a loan of 2300 US dollars to purchase melons and squash to sell. She hopes that the lenders will support her loan.

loans.use: to purchase cucurbits (melon, watermelon, cucumber, squash)

loans.name: Gatai

texts.en:
Gatai is 25 years of age and married with no children. Gatai owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty food products in the local community.  She has 2 years experience in this business.  Gatai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 290 talas or US $121 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Gatai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Gatai's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz tiene 49 años es casada y tiene tres hijos, vive en Tulcán con su familia. Se describe como una persona tranquila, muy trabajadora y le gusta ser amigable.

Trabaja en su negocio ambulante vendiendo papas asadas, es el primer crédito que requiere de FODEMI el mismo que va a utilizar en la compra de papas, gaseosas y sillas para sus clientes lo cual le ayudará a tener más credibilidad con su negocio.

Su sueño es crecer economicamente para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 49 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in Tulcán with her family. She describes herself as a calm person, very hard-working, and she enjoys being friendly.

She works in her business as a street vendor selling roasted potatoes. This is her first loan from FODEMI, and she will use it to purchase potatoes, soft drinks, and chairs for her clients, which will help her to have more credibility for her business.

Her dream is to grow financially in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, soft drinks, and some chairs for her customers

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Ella estudió solo la primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis ciclos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar al capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de casacas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará 150 casacas.  La señora nos cuenta que la mercadería  la compra en Desaguadero y  la vende en la ciudad de Lima. Trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es tener otra casa en Lima y un carro para uso personal.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son  las reuniones en las que comparte con otras socias.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the “La Yunguyeñita” communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 30 years old, married and has two children.  She only completed elementary school.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six cycles.  Her initial, 500 new sol, loan was used to increase working capital in her business; she sells jackets.

She will use her new, 2000 new sol, loan to buy 150 jackets.  She tells us that she buys her merchandise in Desaguadero and sells it in the city of Lima. She works together with her husband.  Her dream is to have another house in Lima and a car for her personal use.   What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings where she can share with other members.

loans.use: to buy 150 jackets.

loans.name: Maarif

texts.en:
Maarif is 47 years old, married, and is the father of three children. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children. 

Maarif is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve, day after day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yield, which is $150 currently. He sells his crops in the Agsu central bazaar.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is a 42-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Oanh and her husband earns money through a business of  repairing and selling air conditioners. They have been involved in this business for ten years. Now, Oanh would like to take out a loan to invest in the business to help it expand. She plans to use this loan to buy and then repair second-hand air conditioners and then sell these to her customers. 

She hopes that through this loan she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. This will enable her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy old air-conditioners to repair and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Gertrudes has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Gertrudes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gertrudes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: La señora Santusa se dedica  a la confección de sombrillas y carpas,  es una cliente antigua, trabaja con en el banco de emprendimiento Bienvenidos, tiene una familia de 2 miembros y su esposo se encuentra de viaje en la ciudad de Santa Cruz por motivos de trabajo, la Sra. Santusa  se encuentra confeccionando sombrillas y con el crédito tiene pensado comprar fierro y lona para poder rebajar sus costos comprando por cantidad, ella piensa estocarse de materia prima para poder abastecer la demanda que existe de estas sombrillas en época de lluvia, con el tiempo tiene pensado agrandar su negocio y que su esposo permanezca en la cuidad de la paz y que sus ingresos mejoren.
texts.en: Santusa's business is making umbrellas and tents.  She is a long-standing client and works with the 'Bienvenidos' (Welcome) community bank.  Her family has two members and her husband is away in the city of Santa Cruz for work reasons.  Santusa sews umbrellas and she plans to use her loan to buy metal and canvas so that she can lower her costs by purchasing in bulk.  She plans to stock up with raw materials so that she can meet the demand that exists for her umbrellas during the rainy season.  Over time, she plans to expand her business, for her husband to stay in the city of La Paz, and for their income to improve.

loans.use: to buy metal and canvas for making umbrellas

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El Señor Maximo, es una persona bien conocida y trabajadora en su sindicato, vive en concubinato y es padre de 3 hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación con su trabajo en el chaco, su mercado es netamente local y su competencia es muy creciente, actualmente sus ingresos le sirven para poder  sobrevivir, el señor se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno y porcino, sus hijos va por las mañanas a la escuela y por las tardes ayudan con las labores en el chaco.
Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo  cuyo destino será la compra de material para el techado de los corrales de su ganado porcino , para contar con una variedad de productos y así poder generar un mas ingresos y mejorar la vida que tiene el y su familia
texts.en:
Mr. Maximo is a well-known, hard-working person in his group.  He lives with his common-law wife and three children whom he supports and maintains through his work on the plantation.  His market is local and competition is ever increasing.  Currently his income allows him merely to survive.  He earns a living raising cattle and pigs.  In the mornings his children go to school and in the afternoons they help him on the plantation.  

This is his first loan and he plans to use it to buy materials to put a roof over the pig stable, as well as obtain other products so he can generate more income and improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy construction material to put a roof on his livestock stables.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 53 years old, married and has 7 children. She lives in the Philippines.

Evangeline is a farmer who operates a gardening business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years and every month she earns PHP 2,000 from this work. Evangeline has been a member of GDMPC for a year.  She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos de 23, 26 y 28 años de edad, administra un molino de nixtamal, donde ofrece el servicio a los vecinos para moler granos básicos, tiene 16 años en esta actividad, trabaja todos los días de 5:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena, cerámica para mejorar la vivienda, esta compra le ayudara para mantener su casa en mejor condición para vivir con sus hijos.
La aspiración de María es terminar la construcción de la vivienda.
texts.en:
María is a single mother with three children (ages 23, 26, and 28). She manages a mill that processes cornmeal. María offers her service to neighbors who need to process basic grains. She has been in business for 16 years and works every day from 5am to 3pm.

María is currently requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, and ceramic tiles in order to improve her home. This purchase will help keep her home in good condition so that her children can live in it. María aspires to finish the construction of her home.

loans.use: to buy materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Fany

texts.es: La socia pertenece Fany; Continua con su negocio de promotora de espectáculos, la socia sigue trayendo algunos grupos musicales para eventos que se realizan en el distrito de Urcos, la socia también tiene una quinta restaurante y vende diferentes platos a la carta y gaseosas, cervezas, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir en la compra de cerevezas y gaseosas para implementar el negocio y seguir prosperando.
texts.en: Fany continues with her business promoting shows. She is still bringing musical groups for events in the district of Urcos. She also has a restaurant where she sells different dishes and soft drinks. At this time, she wants to invest in buying beer and soft drinks to stock her business and keep prospering.

loans.use: to invest in buying beer to stock her business and keep prospering.

loans.name: Amanecer 1 Group

texts.es:
El comité Amanecer 1 se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de San Pedro. Ellas son mujeres de campo muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que se esfuerzan por darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, sin privaciones ni necesidades.
La señora Alberta es una de estas mujeres, ella nos comenta que se dedica a la cría de cerdos y gallinas, en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que desde siempre ella ha hecho esto. Dice que su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que tiene que estar pendiente de los animales que que tiene y ver que no tengan ningún problema.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos pequeños para la cría y posterior venta, además para al compra de alimento para los mismos. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan
texts.en:
The committee Amanecer 1 was formed with the union of various neighbors in the city of San Pedro. They are very hardworking women of the countryside and fighters that strive to provide a better future for their children, without deprivation or needs.
Alberta is one of these women. She tells us that she raises pigs and chickens for a living, which is going very well because she has always done this. She says that her work is very sacrificial as she has to keep track of the animals and she has to ensure that they do not have any problems.
She is requesting this loan in order to purchase small pigs in order to raise and then sell them, and additionally to buy the feed for them. She is very thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that are giving her.

loans.use: to buy small pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación,  el grupo se encuentra en el noveno ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2008.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Ramona, ella tiene 4 hijos , está acompañada con el Sr. Juan y nos cuenta que  ella se dedica hace varios años a la venta de ropas, gracias a lo cual puede ayudar en la casa y a su marido a poder compartir los gastos del día a día. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza por su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, ya que estamos en esa época y tiene muchas ventas. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en: This group came together after contacting a member of Fundación Paraguaya and is now on its ninth loan cycle with the institution since 2008. One of the members is Ramona. She and her husband Juan have four children, and she has made a living selling clothing for a number of years, thanks to which she can help her family and share day-to-day expenses with her husband. She is known as a high-spirited woman who works very hard for her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase summer clothing, since it is currently that time of year and she has a lot of sales. She thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity they are providing.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothes to later sell.

loans.name: Balante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 12 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Banna qui est 2eme à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfants. Mais elle a en sa charge 02 autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la restauration. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités (riz, huile, et ingrédients pour cuisine)

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on March 22, 2001. It comprises 12 women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce

Ms. Banna, who is second from the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's official. She is 55 years old, unmarried, and without children. But she supports two other children entrusted to her by her parents. 

She is active in food service. She has good experience in this business domain which she has been working at for several years. 

This loan will enable her to bolster her capital and to develop her business further (rice, oil, and other ingredients for cooking). 

The profits will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc….) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy food provisions for her restaurant

loans.name: Washington Wilfrido

texts.es:
Washington Wilfrido tiene 41 años de edad vive con su pareja en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 
Washington Wilfrido es operador de mecánica.
Solicita el crédito para realizar la comprar una computadora e impresora. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la computadora e impresora que tanta falta le hacía.

La compra lo hará en Guaranda. El sueño es ver a mis hijos estudiar y sean profesionales que sigan medicina o sean abogados.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es tener un taller propio.
En el tiempo libre le gusta observar y leer folletos de arte.
texts.en:
Washington Wilfrido is 41 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  He and his family live in the city of Guaranda in Bolívar province.  

Washington Wilfrido works as a mechanical operator.  He is asking for a loan so he can purchase computer equipment.  The loan will allow him to pay cash and not in installments, since the interest is very high.  He often purchases farm products in the city of Guaranda.

Washington Wilfrido’s dream is to see his children study and go on to become professionals, such as doctors or lawyers.  The main challenge he faces is to have his own workshop.

In Washington Wilfrido’s free time he enjoys the art world.

loans.use: to purchase computer equipment.

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en:
Tasneem is a 19 year old married woman from Al Russeifeh Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for various products to sell such as makeup and perfumes from Aqaba to sell in her area.In the future she wants to open a shop and she hopes to buy a home.
Since Tasneem is under 30 year old,her loan is considered a youth loan.
Tasneem prefers not to display her photo on the internet,thus the above photo is of her mother's.

loans.use: to pay for various products to sell

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Daniela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de chicharro (comida boliviana tradicional), venta de pollo, taller de tapicería, venta de fruta, costura de pantalones, venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Daniela es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de CD’s; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía a quien ayudaba en su negocio, posteriormente decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de CD’s) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras vendedoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Flor Naciente" (Blooming Flower) is in its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Communal Bank.  This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Daniela as its president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling food, selling "chicharro" (a traditional Bolivian food), selling chicken, selling upholstery, selling fruit, sewing trousers, and selling CDs.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Daniela.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her at her house.  Daniela currently has a business of selling CDs.  She is knowledgeable about this line of work because she learned by helping her aunt with her business.  Eventually she decided to establish her own independent business.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying CDs.  She acquires her products from the distributors in the city of El Alto and then sells them from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to sustain her family.  Daniela is in a common-law relationship and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Daniela said that she enjoys the training seminars about health and credit.

loans.use: to buy CDs to sell.

loans.name: Kloussè

texts.en:
Mr. H. Kloussè was born in Togoville on 4th April 1966. Owing to the acute poverty of his parents, he early dropped out of school and went in for technical training. But during his woodwork training, his parents supported him only for (06) months. Courageous and enterprising, he took care of himself thanks to household tasks he performed at various homes after training sessions. He successfully finished his training but it took him a long time to open his own workshop because he did not have the required resources. The modest workshop he is currently running thanks to a first credit of $350 is not well equipped and this leads to frequent delays in delivering of ordered products. His clients however did not quit because of the quality of his furniture. Mr. H. is married with a seamstress and they have no children yet. His wife is also facing financial hardship and cannot open a workshop. Mr. H. however tries not to let his poverty show; he manages his workshop and his household very well. The credit of $850 he requested will allow him to acquire a little machine for his woodwork and build up a wood stock for sale for there is shortage in the area. The project will allow him to increase revenues and take a better care of his wife and two nieces he is in charge of.
