She has a store selling basic needs items like rice, sugar, and oil, etc.  She also sells bazaar items and other things for the home like dishes, pots, irons and more.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  Her son helps her in the business.  She buys the majority of her products in Portoviejo, and some of them are delivered to her place.  She has had her business for many years, and it has gone well for her. 

 This loan is to buy rice, sugar, oil, tuna, and other products.  She has been in her communal bank for four years.  She likes it because they have helped her a great deal during difficult times.  Her dream is to have a larger store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, tuna, and other products

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina G. is a sari-sari store owner from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 58 years old and married. She has 2 children aged 21 and 25. Cristina sells different kinds of products. She sells soft drinks, bread, etc. Cristina's husband is a fisherman. She also helps him sell his catch in their neighborhood.

Cristina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and fish hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and fish hooks and nets

loans.name: Menerva

texts.en:
Menerva T. is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Tabo-o within the municipality of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Menerva operates a retail store from which she sells daily use items such as milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, spices, canned goods, shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Menerva is just starting this business.

In 2010, Menerva joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from GDMPC of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda C., from the village of Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya, is 32 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Hilda has been raising pigs for breeding for over seven years, earning approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Hilda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase breeding livestock, she is requesting a new loan, her third, for 16000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Hilda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 39 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
An entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk, Oksana is the married mother of a teenage daughter. For the past ten years, Oksana has been selling women’s clothing in one of the local malls. She has a hired salesperson to work for her.

Oksana is requesting a 20,000 Grivnya loan to diversify seasonal merchandise, i.e. purchase additional winter pants and sweaters for women. She is very close to her family, working hard to ensure a decent living for them. Her mom underwent a very complicated heart surgery recently, and Oksana covered all of her medical expenses. Oksana is planning to open an additional vending location in the future and wants to ensure higher education for her daughter, who is going to college this year.

loans.use: To purchase winter merchandise

loans.name: Gulnur

texts.en:
Gulnur T. is a 41-year-old villager, who lives in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. She has two children. Her elder son studies in industrial college and her husband works at the local administration. 

Gulnur has been engaged in cattle breeding for 18 years. She started it with the initial capital of 2,000 KGS and managed to develop her farm with the monthly profit of 4,000 KGS.  Gulnur is a really hard-working woman and is known as a purposeful person. Her striving to provide her children with a better life motivate her to apply for a loan of 70,000 KGS for cattle breeding. She will use it to buy one cow, one bull calf and sheep.  With the revenues, Gulnur plans to reconstruct her house.

Kiva's field partner Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas. This leads to increased employment and meets the interests of both clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Luzviminda's Group

texts.en:
Luzviminda C. is from the village of Faustino, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Luzviminda is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Luzviminda is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables in the local community. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Luzviminda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marie Lamin

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Marie Lamin K..  She is married, and has three children aged 4, 11 and 13 years. In 1991, Marie Lamin K. established her used clothing business to earn income to help her husband support the family.  Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy assorted used clothing. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, she plans to buy a piece of land, educate her children and open another shop.  She is serious and determined.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Segundo Angel

texts.es:
Segundo Angel tiene 37 años, es casada vive con la esposa  y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.   Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada EN EL RECINTO Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas en ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta ver la televisión y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo Angel is 37 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and four children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The Nueva Unión community bank is located in Guamayacu, in Echeandia canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Segundo is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.  He is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  Segundo faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy farmland.

Segundo enjoys watching television and taking part in sports..

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 47 años, es una mujer que vive en unión familiar con su esposo Donato y sus 4 hijos. A los que cuida, alimenta y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca. Desde niña comenzó a amar la tierra, aprendiendo a trabajarla, desde entonces le enseñaron lo necesario para mantener en buen estado sus cultivos y cuando tuvo su primer hijo decidió sembrar independientemente. Desde entonces sus principales sembríos constan de papa, maíz y arveja, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación ya que es consiente que las ganancias dependen de la buena calidad de sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder cortar la maleza que crece entre sus cultivos. Además cuenta que para mantener en perfectas condiciones sus sembríos necesita de mucha inversión, entre fertilizantes naturales y abonos de corral (orgánicos), que tienen mayor costo. También menciona que hace poco abrió una tienda de comestibles, vendiendo productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su localidad.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que le brindan al incorporarla a una asociación responsable. Elena, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en: Elena, who is 47, is a woman who lives in a family that includes her husband Donato and their four children, whom she cares for, feeds, and raises in their own house located in the little village of Villa Visca. As a little girl, she learned to love the land, learning to work it; since then, she was taught what was necessary to keep her crops in good condition, and when she had her first child, she decided to plant independently. Since then, her principal plantings have been potatoes, corn, and peas, which she cares for with much dedication, since it is clear that her earnings depend on the good quality of her products. What she likes most about her work is being able to cut the weeds that grow among her crops. In addition, she tells us that to keep her plantings in perfect condition, she needs to make considerable investments, including natural fertilizer and barnyard manure (organic), which are more expensive. She also mentions that a little while ago she opened a grocery story, selling basic products to the residents of her area. She belongs to the communal bank "Villa Visca," and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is grateful for the support that they offer her in making her a member of a responsible group. Elena will invest the loan she is applying for in the purchase of basic products for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic products to set up her store.

loans.name: Mashenya Kwetungura Group

texts.en: Silver, 47, on left, has been in the agricultural business for the past three years in Kihihi. The happily married father of six grows and sells tea leaves. This business was one he started due to the high demand for tea leaves in Western Uganda. Silver, like many other people in the west of Uganda, grew up in a family with a farming legacy. It was only natural that, with time, he would start bearing a hand in this business. Silver also has a banana plantation where he harvests bananas to sell. This has helped him increase his income. He says his business earnings are Uganda shillings 100,000 a week and, with this loan, he will purchase fertilizer for use in his farming gardens.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his tea gardens

loans.name: Avenir Plus Group

texts.en:
Benz is the leader of the Community Bank “Avenir Plus”, which is composed of 6 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Benz runs a telephone booth and is a photographer in his area which is located west of Kinshasa. He began his business in 2000. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Benz is now well known and liked in this area. He has already received eight MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. His business has prospered and the loans he has received have helped him to rent a well located business place. He makes $40 profit each week. 

With the next loan, Benz intends to purchase more prepaid cards to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. His ambition is to open a cellular phone shop. He is 39 years old and is married. He is the father of two children aged 4 and 8. The oldest attends school.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid cards to meet customer demand and generate additional profits

loans.name: Rwensinga Tumanyane Group

texts.en:
32-year-old Julius sells foods such as beans, coffee and millet. He has been in this business for three years now. The happily married father of four transacts his business from Ntungamo in Western Uganda. He says the fact that he is a farmer has really been of much consequence, the long and short of it being that he is able to restock his stall with the aforementioned foods at his convenience. This normally happens when he is running short on supplies.  

Julius cites determination and perseverance as virtues which have kept him strong in this business. Monthly he says his business profits are to the tune of shillings 600,000. With this Kiva loan, he says  he is going to purchase high-grade manure for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure for his farm.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 54 years old and lives in Dasmarinas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gil, a farmer, and is mother to their seven children, four of whom are working while the youngest is still studying in grade school. Wilma is working hard to put her children through college, because like most Filipino parents she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can give their children.

Wilma makes a living by selling bags, watches, hair accessories and other merchandise. She has been in this business for almost three years and is very knowledgeable about the preferences of her customers, most of whom are students and young people. She earns a minimum of Php 1,500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php 30,000. She will use the money to buy more products and merchandise to sell. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Wilma dreams of having a new outlet store for her products. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners which gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products and merchandise for her store

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, el señor José Emilio   es una persona que tiene bajo su cargo a tres persona es luchadora, responsable, con buenos valores y principios  morales, que lucha para sacar adelante sus hijos para un futuro mejor. 

A esta oficina de ceprodel se presento  a solicitar crédito que será utilizado para remodelación de su vivienda, en hacer un porche,  para darle más seguridad  a su familia y agradece a ceprodel la oportunidad con este desembolso.
texts.en:
José Emilio lives in the city of Managua.  He is a person who has three people in his care.  He is hard working, responsible and has good values and moral principles.  He struggles to get his children ahead in life so that they can have a better future.

José Emilio came to this Ceprodel office to request a loan that he would use to remodel his home by adding a covered outdoor area in order to provide his family with more security.  He is grateful to Ceprodel for the opportunity that he is being given with this loan.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stocks of clothes and cosmetics to sell to her customers.
Laura has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from her furniture-making business. Laura has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a twenty-nine year-old married woman with two children, and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been a tailor for four years, and she has been able to pay school fees for her children with the money earned. Her hardship is seasonal business, and her vision is business expansion plus educating her children.

Elizabeth needs the loan to buy cloth for sewing.

loans.use: To buy cloth for sewing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for horticultural seeds and farmhand labor.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana de 35 años vive al sur de la ciudad con sus dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 5 años, los cuales son el motor de su vida y por los que se esfuerza todos los días, con tal de verlos convertidos en personas exitosas. Ella tiene su negocio que consiste en comercializar papelería, juguetería, ropa infantil, artículos de aseo fantasía y artículos de belleza, ropa, calzado y en general productos por los que sus clientes preguntan y ella registra en su cuaderno,  para comprarlos y siempre responderles oportunamente.
Su vida comercial inició desde el año 2001, pues siendo una persona natural del sector donde habita, aprovechó esta fortaleza para iniciar una actividad que le generara ingresos mientras también atendiera a su familia. Así mismo mediante otra actividad como la oferta de servicios de telecomunicaciones, genera otros ingresos. Su negocio cuenta con una buena infraestructura donde se destaca el orden en sus vitrinas, estantería y muebles exhibidores y 8 equipos de comunicacion, para el ejercicio de su actividad. Su principal mercado son los habitantes de la comunidad donde está ubicado su negocio y especialmente maneja clientela de mujeres y jóvenes, a quienes vende de contado y a crédito. Su creciente clientela, hace que su capital de trabajo se torne insuficiente para atender muchas veces la demanda del mercado y es esta la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos de belleza al por mayor, y papelería pues son los artículos de más alta rotación y que le generan mayor rentabilidad. Ella requiere obtener descuentos comprando de contado y en una importante cantidad de estos productos . Su meta más adelante es independizar su vida productiva de su vida familiar,adecuando su vivienda para tener el sociego que tanto anhela. además de ofrecerles una educación de calidad a sus hijos. Mientras Ana trabaja para cumplir su sueño, maneja en su negocio un margen de contribución  no menor del 46,48%, una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 9 días, mientras sus inventarios rotan cada 139 días, con una margen de utilidad del 12,4% que con sus credikivas futuros planea aumentar imprimiéndolo un buen manejo, para que su rotación sea mas rápida.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old and lives to the south of the city with her two children, ages 4 and 5. They are her motivation in life so she strives to do her best every day so that they can become successful people. Ana has a business that consists of selling stationery, toys, baby clothes, premium toiletries, beauty products, clothing, shoes, and general products that are requested by her customers. She records the orders in her notebook and then buys the products, always responding in a prompt manner.

Ana started her business in 2001 as a native of the local area. Relying on her inner strength, she established a business in order to generate income while taking care of her family. In addition, Ana operates another business providing telecommunication services as an extra form of income. Her business has a good infrastructure that includes display cases, shelving, furniture displays, and eight communication stations to keep her venture running. Her primary market consists of residents of the community where her business is located, especially women and young people. Ana conducts her sales for cash or on credit. Due to her growing customer base, Ana’s operating capital has become insufficient on several occasions when she needed to keep up with the demands of the marketplace.

This is the reason why she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy beauty products in bulk, stationery, and other products that have high turnover so that she can generate more profits. Ana wants to obtain discounts by purchasing these products with cash and in large quantities. Her goal moving forward is to become independent in her business life and productive in her family life. She wants to remodel her home so that she can live the peaceful life that she craves. In addition, Ana wants to provide a quality education for her children. Meanwhile she continues to work to fulfill her dream. Ana manages her business with a contribution margin of no less than 46.48%, an accounts receivable period of 9 days, inventory turnover of 139 days, and a profit margin of 12.4%. With her future Kiva loans, she plans to put more emphasis on good management so that she can have faster turnover rates.

loans.use: to buy beauty products in bulk, stationery, and other products that have high turnover.

loans.name: Diego Alejandro

texts.es: El Joven Diego se dedica a la costura y venta balones de futbol solicita el crédito para la compra de materia para la costura de los balones ( cuero, pegamento y pinturas de distintos colores  además de otros materiales ) ya que en estas fechas  por  las fiestas que hay en la localidad de Quillacollo existe gran pedido de balones de futbol y necesita capital para poder comprar material para la costura de balones, se dedica a esta actividad hace seis  años como propietario se dedica a esta  actividad  desde su niñez ya que su padre se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya mas de veinte años. Sus padres indican que es muy responsable  y  que colabora en el hogar con los ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Young Diego makes and sells soccer balls. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of material for making the balls (leather, adhesive, and different-coloured paints, and other materials), as there is great demand for soccer balls at the moment due to the parties in Quillacollo. He needs capital in order to be able to buy material for making the balls. He has been a business owner for six years but has done this work since he was a child, as his father has also done this work for over 20 years. His parents say that he is very responsible and that he helps out with the household costs.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making soccer balls.

loans.name: Eudomilia

texts.es: Eudomilia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito D. Mostaza, tiene 67 años y 7 hijos, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 4 años. Eudomilia tiene un Bodega en su casa, es Profesora cesante, empezó su negocio hace mas D. 10 años, ella y su esposo se turnaban para poder atender en la tienda, empezaron con poco ahora su tienda ha crecido, gracias a Finca ella pudo administrar bien su negocio, el ahorro que le inculcan en su Banco Comunal le ayudó a poder hacer crecer su negocio mas rápido, ahora ella desea comprarse un carrito para poder pasar si vejez, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en vasos D. tecnopor para helados
texts.en:
Eudomilia is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito D. Mostaza” (Mustard Seed). She is 67 years old and has seven children. Eudomilia has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years. She is a retired school teacher and has a store in her home. Eudomilia started her business more than 10 years ago. She and her husband take turns managing the store. They started with very little, but now their business has grown. Thanks to FINCA Peru, Eudomilia has been able to manage her business well. The savings she accumulated through her Communal Bank has helped her to grow her business more quickly.

Now she wants to buy a small car so that she can travel around in her old age. At the moment, this loan will be invested in styrofoam cups for selling ice cream.

loans.use: to purchase styrofoam cups and other products for her business.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children.

Suleiman has been an owner of an herbal shop since 2010. Selling and preparing medicinal herbs and natural herbs, including herbal teas and seeds, he has more than ten years' experience in the types of herbs and their benefits. He has a good reputation, and his shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $1,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. He runs a butchery to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years. He has employed four people to help him to run the business. He also roasts and sells meat in the same business premises. 

Joseph has retained his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In five years, he wants to become more financially stable. He has requested for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy an energy-saving cooker for roasting meat.

loans.use: To buy an energy-saving cooker.

loans.name: Maurime

texts.en:
Maurime is 25 years old and single. She has one child, age 4. She owns a salon and has been in the business for the past two years. She has a monthly income of KES 7,000.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to buy cosmetics for the salon.

She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her child. Her dream is to expand the business and be more productive.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for the salon.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan, es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con la familia, se dedica a la compra y venta de pan, además de atender la agricultura, lleva 5 años en la siembra de maíz y frijol, la venta de pan la realiza desde hace dos años, esta venta es de forma ambulante, distribuyendo a clientes en su bicicleta.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas, para aplicarlos al cultivo de maíz, esto le ayudara para fortalecer la planta y que esta produzca mejor.
La aspiración de Juan es terminar sus estudios universitarios, apoyar a su familia con lo poco que pueda de sus ganancias.
texts.en: Juan is single and has no children.  He is a bread merchant and also a farmer.  He’s been farming corn and beans for five years and has been selling bread for two years.  He’s a street merchant selling the bread to customers from his bicycle.  He’s asking for a loan to buy manure and herbicide for his corn crops which will help him strengthen the plants so that they will produce better.  Juan’s goal is to complete his university studies and to support his family which whatever little he can with his profits.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Weyogonga Group

texts.en:
Chrisostim is the facilitator of the Weyogonga group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Chrisostim takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Chrisostim had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Chrisostim was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Chrisostim and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Chrisostim will invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Weyogonga group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
In the photograph above, Chrisostim is pictured with his group members. The field officer is standing on the far right.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fayzikhon

texts.ru: Файзихон 32 – летний женатый мужчина. У него семеро детей. Он занимается торговлей национальной мужской одежды. Еще он продает тюбетейки. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов тюбетеек.
texts.en: Fayzikhon is thirty-two and married with seven children. He makes his living selling ethnic clothing for men. He also sells skullcaps. He plans to use his loan to buy new styles of caps.

loans.use: to buy new styles of skullcaps.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single mother of three children; two attend school while one is still too young. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Agnes has operated a wine and spirits business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a clothes sales business which provides her with another source of income. She faces a challenge of inflation in her business. 

Agnes plans to use this KES 70,000 loan to purchase more stock of wines and spirits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more wines and spirits for resale.

loans.name: G.s Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está conformado por Flor Dely y Ivan Desiree cada uno tiene su negocio, ambos son del misma actividad económica y han luchado para salir adelante con sus negocios. La señora Flor Dely tiene 31 años edad en el negocio tiene 18 años de experiencia en  artesanía en barro que es una actividad económica tradicional, ella está solicitando crédito para poder comprar mercadería como alcancía, jarrones, comales y ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad en artesanía.
texts.en:
This community bank consists of Flor Dely and Ivan Desiree. 

Each one has their own business. Both are in the same line of work and they have fought to get ahead in their businesses. 

Flor Dely is 31 years old and has 18 years of experience in the field of clay which is a traditional way to earn money. She is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as piggy banks, vases, and cooking pots in order to offer her customers a variety of crafts.

loans.use: to buy piggy banks, vases, and cooking pots

loans.name: Mario Roberto

texts.es:
Don Mario tiene 48 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos, Mario se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de comidas como ser golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos, su negocio esta bien ubicado ya que por esa zona transitan muchas personas que viven en zonas aledañas montañosas y lo prefieren ya que sus comidas son muy sabrosas y tambien los precios son accesibles para dicha comunidad.
don Mario utilizara el credito para comprar mesas, sillas, manteles y utencilios de cocina, asi podra dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, que se sientan mas cómodos al ingresar a consumir a su negocio.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
don mario tiene una ayudante para preparar las comidas y atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Mario is 48 years old, lives with his partner, and has three children. He runs a food business selling candy, breakfasts, and lunches. His business is well-located as it is in an area where lots of people who live in the nearby mountains pass through. They like his food as it’s very tasty and the prices are affordable.

Mario will use the loan money to buy tables, chairs, tablecloths, and cooking utensils so that he will be able to provide a better service to his customers. They will feel more comfortable when they come to eat the food he makes. Mario needs to earn more money so that he and his family can get ahead. He has an assistant to help him prepare the food and serve the customers.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, tablecloths, and cooking utensils

loans.name: Por Fe Vivimos 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Clara is one of the members of the Por Fe Vivimos 1, 2 & 3 (By Faith We Live) Group, located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. This group, comprised of 15 members, are dedicated to selling different products all over their rural community and visiting some others nearby.

Clara makes bags of food, with many different meals, and then she sells them for biweekly payments according to the days of most companies' payroll days. People make credit purchases and then pay her in one or two payments during a month. With this loan, she is planning to buy ingredients for different meals to prepare the food packages. 

This is Clara's twelfth loan. She has been taking out loans for about eight years and has successfully repaid all her previous loans. She started her business after she took out her first Esperanza loan. With her business and the loans, she has increased her income and capital to improve her business and her life. 

She is a divorced mother with two children. She cares for and works for their needs. Clara's dream is to continue improving her business. She is planning to reinvest her profits in the business and save. She thanks all of you for your support!!

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina tiene 64 años de edad, es madre y padre para su único hijo, ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica de es la venta de productos de belleza  como perfumes, lápices labiales, colonias, collares, pulseras, aretes, cremas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.
 
En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como perfumes, lápices labiales y otras cosas más. 

La socia se encuentra contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntuales y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Georgina is 64 years old and is both mother and father to her only son.  Georgina was born in the city of Cusco and she continues to live there now.  For a living she sells beauty products such as perfumes, lipstick, cologne, necklaces, bracelets, earrings, creams and other items.  She has been doing this for some years now and it is going very well, thanks to her determination.

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more merchandise such as perfumes, lipstick and other things.

Georgina is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.  She is grateful for the help provided.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as perfumes and lipstick, among other things.

loans.name: Degnon Group

texts.fr: DEGNON est un groupe  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Sourou, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 59 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Sourou est mariée à un certain Boniface. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Sourou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Sourou vend de l’huile d’arachide à son domicile depuis trente quatre ans. Sourou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Sourou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DEGNON un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter de l’huile d’arachide.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is 19 years old. He is not married and has one child. He has had a retail shop business for two years. He will be using the loan to purchase retail goods e.g. sugar, rice and tea leaves and hopes this will help him to save and plough some money back into his business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase retail goods such as sugar, rice and tea leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up a hair salon business

loans.name: Mawupénya

texts.en:
Born in 1969, Mawupénya A. is married with four children. She grows vegetables to make ends meet. Her husband, a farmer, isn’t making enough money to meet the family’s needs. Despite being illiterate, she is a member of a farming group, which has given her instruction and allowed her to apply for loans.

She is presently requesting a $950 loan to buy fertilizer and increase the size of her field to meet the high demand for food in the area. The earnings will be used to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969, Madame A. Mawupénya est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Pour contribuer aux charges du ménage, elle s’appuie sur les revenus de son travail de maraîchage. Son mari, agriculteur de profession n’a pas une bonne situation financière qui puisse permettre l’épanouissement de la famille. Bien qu’elle soit analphabète, Madame A. Mawupénya fait partie d’un groupement agricole avec lequel elle a pu suivre plusieurs formations et gérer des crédits.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 destiner à acheter des engrais pour élargir son champ afin de satisfaire les nombreux besoins sur les marchés environnants. Le bénéfice sera destiné à l’amélioration des conditions sociales de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and increase size of farmland

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children between fourteen and two years old.

Prossy, partly the bread winner of the home, has been in the retail business for three years. She sells household commodities.

She wishes to borrow funds to increase her stock, which will eventually increase her income. She hopes to repay the loan in six installments.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Nelson Sabino

texts.es:
Nelson is 42 years old and married. He lives with his wife Zunilda, who is 45. They have a 2 year old son who is the joy of the house. Nelson's wife is a housewife and spends all of her time caring for and educating their only son.

Nelson is a carpenter. He tells the story of how he started out in this profession at the age of 8, helping a well known carpenter in Itá. The carpenter taught him the profession until Nelson had the opportunity to become independent and start his own carpentry workshop in his home.

He crafts all kinds of furniture, including wardrobes, kitchen furniture, chairs and tables, among other pieces. He makes furniture to order for his clients. Nelson comments that he sees a lot of demand for his products, since they are finely finished, and he is one of the least expensive craftsmen in the city.

He sadly tells the story of how he was robbed 22 days ago. The thieves took the motor of one of his wood cutting tools. He urgently needs to buy another in order to continue working and supporting his family.

The motor will cost up to $200 and Nelson needs a loan with which to buy it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Nelson tiene 42 años, es casado y vive con su esposa Zunilda que tiene 45 años. Tienen un hijo pequeño de dos años de edad que es la alegría de la casa. La esposa de Nelson es ama de casa y se encarga exclusivamente del cuidado y de la educación de su único hijo.

Nelson es carpintero. Cuenta que se inició en la profesión desde los 8 años de edad. Comenzó ayudando a un conocido carpintero de la ciudad de Itá que fue formándolo en la profesión hasta que tuvo la oportunidad de independizarse y montar su propia carpintería en su casa.

Elabora todo tipo de muebles como roperos, muebles de cocina, sillas, mesas, entre otros, todos a pedido de su clientela ya formada. Cuenta que tiene mucha demanda debido a la fina terminación de sus trabajos, además de ser una de las manos de obra más baratas de la ciudad. El costo de dicho motor asciende a US$ 200 y Nelson necesita de un préstamo para comprarlo.

loans.use: Buy a new motor for the wood-cutting machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items for her cafe.

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Born August 10, 1974 in Lomé, in the Gulf Prefecture, Togo, Mr. Michel B. stopped school after the primary grades and began an apprenticeship. Married and father of two children, he is a trained carpenter and now has his own workshop but because of lack of capital, he is not able to cope well with his financial needs, especially since his wife does not work outside the home. For these reasons, Mr. B. is not able to do well by his family. He is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to improve his business and better the lives of his children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 10 Août 1974 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe monsieur Michel B. a arrêté ses études au cours primaire. Il s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Il est menuisier de formation et aujourd’hui il tient son propre atelier mais faute de moyen financier, il n’arrive pas à joindre les deux bouts avec sa famille, puisque sa femme n’exerce aucun métier. Ainsi monsieur Michel B. avec son petit revenu n’arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Il sollicite donc un montant de $300 pour renforcer ses activités et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.

loans.use:
improving his business

renforcement de ses activités

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
Hannah Amissah Brown sells provisions such as milk, milo, pepsodent, sugar, rice, biscuits etc. she is married with one daughter aged 14 years. Her husband is a photographer and his income is low. To help with the family finances, Hannah works very hard. She also buys eggs and distributes them to her customers. Her shop is also located at a busy market here in cape coast.
One major challenge that Hannah faces is that she has to make an advance payment before she receives her supply (eggs) from her suppliers. At the moment, she has lots of orders from her customers for the supply of eggs.
Hannah is asking for a loan of US $ 1,100 dollars to enable her buy more eggs and supply it to her customers.

loans.use: To buy eggs to supply to her customers

loans.name: Rhina Luz

texts.es:
Señora Rhina Luz P. lives in Ciudad Arce and has three children. Her husband helps her by selling clothing, but the money he obtains through these sales isn't enough to support their family. This is why Rhina started a store where she sells basic food items (coffee, broth, bread, sauces, etc.) in her home several years ago. She uses the earnings from her store to supplement her family's income. The requested loan will be used to purchase products to further supply her store and also to purchase more clothing. Rhina hopes to start selling wholesale and to generate more income, with the aim of obtaining economic stability and a better future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Rhina Luz P., vive en Ciudad Arce, tiene 3 hijos, su esposo le ayuda a través D. la venta D. ropa, pero el dinero que obtiene en la comercialización D. la ropa no es suficiente para mantener a la familia, debido a ello doña Rhina desD. hace ya varios años estableció una tienda D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad(café, consomés, pan, salsas,etc) en su casa, con la cual logran complementar el sostenimiento D. la familia, el préstamo solicitado es para comprar productos para surtir más la tienda y también compra D. más ropa , con el afán D. empezar a vender por mayoreo y generar con ello más ingresos, con el fin D. lograr estabilidad económica y un futuro más digno para ella y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase products to further supply her store and to purchase more clothing

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Irene M. is 20 years old and she is married with two children. Her children are 2 and 4 years old, respectively. In 2000 Irene established a crop-selling, fish-selling, and coffee business. Irene now seek a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of crops, fish, and coffee in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA:
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing whereby SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA will purchase equipment from said client, extend a loan to her, and then lease the same equipment back to her – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, financial institutions do not consider Tanzanian women to be credit-worthy because they lack tangible assets that could serve as collateral. As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of crops, fish, and coffee in bulk.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys is a hard-working woman who, with great satisfaction, overcame the financial hardships she was born into. Her desire to raise her children, led her to open a small store in her home six years ago. Since then, her attention to customer service has turned her neighbors into some of her best customers. The increase in monthly income has allowed her to offer higher quality products and her clientele has grown exponentially because of the quality of service and confidence she offers. She'd like to take advantage of the opportunity by asking for a loan so she can increase the amount of stock in her small store to satisfy customer demand. With your help, this hard-working mother will make her dream a reality.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys, es una mujer muy trabajadora y ha superado con mucha satisfacción los momentos de escasez económica por las que venía atravesando su familia. Con el deseo de permanecer siempre al cuidado de sus pequeños decidió aperturar una pequeña tienda en las instalaciones de su hogar hace seis años, con la agradable atención que ella ofrece a sus vecinos los ha ido convirtiendo en sus mejores clientes, con las ganancias que ha ido acumulando mes a mes ha incrementado la calidad de sus productos, sin embargo tiene un pequeño inconveniente, muy agradable por cierto, la cantidad de personas que acuden diariamente a realizar las compras en este pequeña tienda se ha ido incrementando notablemente gracias a la calidad de servicio y confianza que les ofrece.Su deseo es no desaprovechar esta oportunidad y ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para incrementar la cantidad de productos en su pequeña bodeguita para complacer las peticiones de cada uno de sus clientes. Con vuestra ayuda el deseo de esta trabajadora madre hará sus sueños realidad.

loans.use: To buy stock, like basic necessities, for her store.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Mr. Paulino Q. is 35 years old and married to Mrs. Isadora Ortega, who is 31. They have 1 son and live in their own home in a neighborhood of the city of Santaní.

Paulino is a multifaceted man. He works selling clothing together with his wife. She stays at home to sell the merchandise in the small store they have set up in their home while Paulino travels the neighborhoods offering his products. In addition to his sales work, Paulino is a teacher and director of a small local school where children, especially those with scarce resources who work during the day, attend night school.

Paulino says that despite being a humble man he aspires to instill in his students the idea and the example, through his own life, that those who want to get ahead can. Working and studying is a reality for many children in Paraguay who come from poor families and who from a very young age must learn to earn a living just to eat. He wants his country to generate more sources of work for older people. He desires with all his heart that Paraguay progresses so that two year old childen no longer have to beg in the streets and children from 4 years old no longer have to go out to sell sweets and wash windows when they ought to be learning and playing.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Paulino Q. tiene 35 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Isidora Ortega de 31 años de edad, tienen 1 hijo y viven en su casa propia en un barrio de la ciudad de Santaní.

El señor Paulino es un hombre multifacético, se dedica a la venta de ropas junto con su esposa, ella queda en la casa a vender las mercaderías en una pequeña tienda que tienen ahí mientras que Paulino recorre los barrios ofreciendo sus productos. Además de sus ventas, Paulino es docente y director de un pequeño colegio de la zona en donde acuden especialmente niños de escasos recursos y que trabajan por las mañanas y por las noches acuden a la escuela.

Paulino dice que a pesar de ser un hombre humilde, el desea inculcar a sus alumnos el ejemplo del que quiere puede superarse, trabajar y estudiar es una realidad de muchos niños de nuestro país, que provienen de familias muy humildes y desde temprana edad deben aprender a ganarse el pan.

Paulino se dedica a la venta de ropas hace mas de dos años y desea seguir progresando en las mismas, hoy el solicita un crédito que lo ayudará a comprar mercaderías en mayores cantidades, esto a su vez le ayuda a obtener mejores descuentos por sus compras al por mayor.

El desea que su país genere más fuentes de trabajos a personas mayores, desea de corazón que el país salga adelante para evitar que niños de dos años estén pidiendo limosnas en las calles y niños desde los 4 años tengan que salir a vender golosinas y limpiar vidrios cuando deberían estar aprendiendo y jugando.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Karoli's Group

texts.en:
Karoli J., age 34, single with one 8-year-old child, has a retail shop which he began three years ago. He works in his shop daily from 6:30 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. and is able to make a monthly profit of about $99.

In the past, Karoli has taken out two previous loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his shop stock. He hopes for a new loan to go upcountry and buy big stocks of beans and rice. Karoli will share this loan with his subgroup members, who operate businesses in tailoring, selling charcoal, fruits, ties and dyes, bread, and telephone vouchers..

In the picture Karoli is the first on the left back row standing.

loans.use: To go upcountry and buy large stocks of beans and rice.

loans.name: Abavi Coco

texts.fr:
Ms. Abavi Coco B. was born in 1978 in Lomé. She sells shoes at the large market in Lomé. In 2007, a 500,000 CFA franc loan from WAGES allowed her to start selling handbags as well. She then realized that this was a good business and that she was selling more handbags than shoes. This second loan she is requesting will allow her to purchase 60 handbags.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle B. Abavi Coco est née en 1978 à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse de chaussures au grand marché de Lomé. En 2007, le crédit de 500.000 FCFA qu’elle a obtenu auprès de WAGES lui a permis d’entamer le commerce de sacs de sortie. Par la suite elle a remarqué que ce dernier commerce marchait mieux que le premier et donc elle vend plus les sacs que les chaussures. Le second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter soixante (60) sacs de sortie.

loans.use: Purchase of 60 handbags

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es:
The “Manos Unidas” (Hands United) Group is comprised of neighbors from the 29 de Agusto neighborhood in the city of Ypane. All of the members are working mothers and are united by this having this in common. Seventeen of the eighteen members are pictured in the photograph above. All members have their own activity and some have full time jobs outside of this work in which case they perform this work during their free time to augment their household incomes. The group has a well established organizational structure and the members get along harmoniously.

The membership has demonstrated its unity on several occasions and are working well together, solving problems at the group level. They have used loans as a way to expand their sales and indicate that the loans have been very helpful in accomplishing this. The are asking for a new loan which will be used for the purchase of various items, the majority of which will be for the raw materials needed for the activities of each member. Some, such as those who operate stores and work in food sales, will purchase items including: meat, sugar, rice, vegetables, dairy products and necessary utensils. Members who work in clothing sales will purchase merchandise to increase the amount and variety of products they offer.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

El Comité “Manos Unidas” se formó de la unión de varias vecinas del barrio 29 de Agosto de la ciudad de Ypane. Todas las integrantes del comité son madres y trabajadoras, por lo que las une ambas cosas. En la fotografía tomada, se encuentran 17 de las 18 integrantes del comité.

Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades propias, aunque algunas tienen trabajos formales, desarrollan sus emprendimientos en un tiempo extra para acrecentar sus ingresos. El comité lleva una organización bien establecida y las relaciones fluyen de manera armoniosa entre todos sus miembros.

Sus integrantes han demostrado su unidad en varias ocasiones, ya sea desarrollando actividades en forma conjunta, como solucionando cualquier inconveniente a nivel grupal.

Ellas utilizan el crédito como medio para expandir sus ventas y manifiestan que les resulta de gran ayuda. Hoy ellas solicitan un nuevo crédito que será invertido en la compra de variados artículos, la mayoría de ellos, materia prima para las actividades de las integrantes del comité. Algunos de estos artículos son: carnes, azúcar, arroz, verduras, lácteos, etc.; estos artículos serán comprados por aquellas señoras que posee despensas, kiosco, copetín, etc. Las personas dedicadas a la venta de comidas utilizarán el crédito para la compra de materia prima y utensilios para su trabajo. Las vendedoras de ropas lo invertirán en la compra de mercaderías de manera a aumentar el stock y su variedad.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing; merchandise for stores, including sugar, milk, meat, baked goods, canned goods, sweets, utensils, rice, fruit, vegetables, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is the wife of M. H. Jaffery and has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 28 years. She owns a two room brick house. Irshad baji and her family are very well educated. She and her elder daughter finished their Masters degrees. Irshad baji is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her second eldest daughter is also a teacher and completed her Bachelors degree. Her eldest daughter will start a job as a teacher right after finishing her Masters degree. Her youngest daughter is in 11th standard (grade). Her eldest son and the next eldest completed 12th standard (grade) and started making bicycle springs. Her two younger sons completed their Bachelors degrees and are army officers. Her husband is a land owner and completed his Bachelors degree. She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more materials for her sons’ bicycle spring business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy animals food to resell. Ramzan baji wants a loan to buy a floor waxing machine. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy more inventory for her grocery shop. Muniran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheel vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Good Never Done Group

texts.en:
This group is called Good Never Done. This is their 3rd time of getting a loan from Kiva through SMT. They have repaid previous loans successfully and are now requesting a new loan to further enhance their businesses.

These entrepreneurs are requesting a loan of Le 2,400,000.00. Their names are Delvin A. S., Kadiatu C. and Umu T.. All of them sell in Magburaka town market. Delvin is the group`s leader. He is 38, married with 4 children. Delvin sells jewelry at the Magburaka market. He has been in this business for 13 years now.

loans.use: Buy more jewelry to add to existing business inventory

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto inició el negocio ya que anteriormente era empleado repartidor de una empresa se salió para distribuirle producto a una panadería que actualmente ya cerro, por esta razón comenzó su negocio hace 4 años y actualmente distribuye apasteladas, galleta fina y polvorón, directamente a una panadería; un amigo le presta el carro para llevar la mercancía y le paga la gasolina que le gasta, con la desventaja de que esta limitado a cierto horario.

El necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir una camioneta usada la cual le servirá para la distribución de su producto, y tener la facilidad de poder adquirir mas clientes ya que el vehículo que utilizara será propio.
texts.en:
Humberto started the business after leaving his previous job as a delivery man for another enterprise to distribute products to a bakery that is now closed. For this reason, he started his business four years ago and he currently distributes sweets, cookies and shortbreads directly to a bakery. A friend of his lends him a car to use to deliver his merchandise, for which he reimburses him for the gas he uses. This has a disadvantage in that it limits him to a certain schedule.

He needs a loan of $575 USD, to be repaid in six months, to buy a used truck with which to distribute his merchandise. This will provide a great deal of relief in that he can attract more customers, since the vehicle would be his own.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a small truck.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua. Norma es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Norma tiene un puesto propio en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende flores variados, que adquiere en el mismo mercado de los productores, actividad que realiza desde las 3 de la mañana. Además Norma junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Norma necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de flores variadas. Norma sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos, comprar un carro para realizar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the "Llapanchik" Community Bank. Llapanchik means "everyone united" in quechua. Norma lives with her husband. She is 36 years old and has three children. She owns a sales stall at the food market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells all kinds of flowers. She buys her flowers fresh from the field -- an activity she begins at 3:00 in the morning. In addition, Norma and her husband own a car with which they provide taxi service in Ayacucho. Norma needs a loan of 2,000 soles [about US$ 650], which she will invest in the purchase of different kinds of flowers. She dreams of helping her children get ahead and buying a car to start another business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flowers for sale

loans.name: Fumi

texts.en: Fumi sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs in her house. She has had this small business for a while. Fumi is 28 years old and married with two children. Fumi lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO Microfinance client. Fumi is requesting a loan of N100, 000 ($850 USD) to purchase more groceries to sell to customers. She says thank you to all the Kiva lenders for their financial support and to LAPO microfinance for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, drinks, and provisions to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Martha A. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of 11 and 25 years old.

Martha has been running a café business, or mama lishe. A mama lishe (local restaurant or café) in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), and plantains (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

Since 2004, Martha has worked at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. Martha currently earns about 500 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500 USD in order to buy beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. In the future, she plans to expand her café business. Martha thanks you for her support! About the lending partner: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and payback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces for her cafe.

loans.name: J Guadalupe

texts.es: El señor J Guadalupe V. M. es una persona ya grande de edad el cual recibe pensión del IMSS. Guadalupe a pesar de los años que tiene casado el se preocupa por el bienestar de su esposa y se ve a la necesidad de pedir un préstamo para comprar aire secos con calefacción; comenta que la casa donde viven en tiempo de verano es muy caliente y en invierno muy fría. La cantidad que el solicita es de $10,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Mr. J Guadalupe V. M. is an elderly man who receives a pension from IMSS—the Mexican Social Security Institute. Despite all the years he has been married, Guadalupe still worries about his wife’s well-being, so he feels the need to request a loan in order to purchase a heater and an air conditioner. He states that the house in which he lives gets very hot in the summer and very cold in the winter. He is requesting $10,000.00 Mexican Pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Heating and air conditioning

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert N. is married to Mary and blessed with seven children. Three of the children are under 15 years of age. He is a very hardworking man. He has faced numerous financial difficulties, especially when he lost his job and was not able to meet the family needs and educate his children. He also lost his lovely daughter who was by his side, supporting him to meet the family needs.

Gilbert joined GHAPE in 2003 and made a loan of 20000 FRS, which he invested in poultry. As the years went by and his business grew, he went further and added pig farming as one of his businesses. N. is a carpenter by profession and he will be investing his loan in furniture; selling of planks, making chairs, cupboards, tables, beds and other item from wood. His business will succeed because he has been doing this particular trade for some time in his community. He also plans to continue his pig farm and will used part of the loan to buy piglets, feed and medication to keep the farm running.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of planks, cloth, nails, and piglets

loans.name: Lynneth

texts.en: Lynneth E., 22, single, is a resident of Pangantucan, Bukidnon, Southern Philippines.  She has  been with her grandmother after the death of her parents. She stopped going to college to take care of her aging grandmother.  She did not lose hope instead  she started a barbecue/grilled chicken business in her place. Until now this business is still active after receiving  financial support from HSPFI.  For now, she is looking for an additional capital of PHP8000 to purchase in large volume dressed whole chicken for grilling. She hopes to be legally married to her live-in partner soon and work  on her business to make it more sustainable.

loans.use: To purchase in large volume of  dressed whole chicken

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun P., 40, resides with her husband and two of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She operates a grocery store to earn a living and is able to make about $5 every day, while her husband is a farmer and earns $2 per day.

Mrs. Bun P. would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie D. C. is a 44 year-old mother of two. Her husband is a farmer and works on a small parcel of land. They grow vegetables to support the needs of the family. She is very fortunate to have loans available from ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to start vegetable farming. She applied for this loan to buy pigs for fattening and farming supplies such as fertilizers and insecticides to continue their previous business. She hopes to sell pigs and vegetables at the market for a higher price. She wants to save money for the education of her children. She dreams of building a better house and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy pigs for fattening and farming supplies for her vegetables

loans.name: Tuhfaniso

texts.ru: Тухфанисо 51 год Она замужем и имеет 2-х детей. Сын уже женился. Он живет с Тухфанисо. А дочь вышла замуж и живет отдельно с мужем. Муж Тухфанисо уехал в Россию работать. Тухфанисо занимается продажей хлопчатобумажной ткани на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Она привозит товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Её сын помогает Тухфанисо. Отвозит товар на рынок и привозит по окончанию дня. Тухфанисо берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Tuhfaniso is 51 years old. She is married and has two children. Her son has already married and lives with Tuhfaniso. Her daughter has also married and lives separately with her husband. Tuhfaniso's husband has went to Russia for work. Tuhfaniso is in the business of selling cotton fabrics on the market Farovon in the town of Gafurov. She brings her merchandise from the wholesale market of Istaravshan. Her son also helps her. He delivers the merchandise to the market and back at the end of the day. Tuhfaniso needs a loan to increase the assortment and to expand business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru: Тиллоев Аскар житель района Рудаки. Возраст 40 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает таксистом  по маршруту Рудаки-Душанбе. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 10 лет. Жена работает на рынке . Торгует автозапчастями. Таким образом они вместе работают и обеспечивают семью. Но автомашина Аскара требует ремонта, для чего он и запрашивает кредит. Он сможет произвести капремонт и обеспечить себя работой без перебоев.
texts.en:
Askar T. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 40 years old, married and has four children. He works as a taxi driver on the Rudaki-Dushanbe route. He has been in this business for ten years now. His wife works on the market and sells auto parts. This way they work together and provide for the family. Askar's car needs a repair for which he needs a loan. He will make the repairs and continue working without interruptions.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a car

loans.name: Magife

texts.en: Magife S. is from the village of Dumagoc. She is 35 years old, married, and has two infant children. Magife sells specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately Php 7,000 a month. Magife joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of Php 6,000 which she will use to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 3rd loan from Paglaum MPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ni Nengah Witoni

texts.en:
"Ni Nengah Witoni - (DNR.M-0697) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu - Melaya.  She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Nengah Witoni owns & operates a business making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Ni Nengah Witoni has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,000,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2007, Ni Nengah Witoni joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Nengah Witoni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.  Ni Nengah Witoni is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Ni Nengah Witoni plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Nengah Witoni - (DNR.M-0697) merupakan 45 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 4 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Nengah Witoni memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pangan.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuat & menjual makanan.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual beraneka ragam produk makanan di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Ni Nengah Witoni sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Nengah Witoni menghasilkan sekitar 1,000,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Nengah Witoni bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Nengah Witoni meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli kendaraan pengangkut untuk meningkatkan bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli produk tambahan untuk dijual.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Nengah Witoni berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 54 years old. Erlinda is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
