Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMP)C is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos M. V. reside en el municipio de mejicanos del departamento de San Salvador. Carlos tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de los cuales dos aun se encuentran estudiando y solo uno trabaja. Carlos posee un negocio de reparación de relojes y venta de accesorios para los mismos, el destino del crédito que solicita Carlos es para la compra de mercadería para su negocio ya que desea adquirir de más variedad en accesorios y también para la compra de beterías que se utilizan para los relojes.
texts.en:
Carlos M. V. lives in the Mejicanos municipality in the San Salvador department. Carlos, 43, lives with his wife and three children. Two of his children are still in school; only one works. Carlos has a watch repair business, and he sells accessories for the watches. The loan that Carlos is asking for is to buy merchandise for his business. He wants to have a bigger variety of accessories, and he also wants to buy watch batteries.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy watch accessories and batteries

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun V. is a 36-year-old construction foreman. He is married to Horm Yan, 29, and they have three school-aged children. His wife sells a few grocery items out of her home for income.

Currently, Hun V. finds it hard traveling to work or anywhere else, because he doesn’t have his own vehicle for his and his family’s transportation. Because he has no adequate money to buy it yet, he would like a loan from Kiva to add to his savings in order to purchase an old motorbike to ride to work at his building place.

loans.use: To purchase an old motorbike to ride to work

loans.name: Paula Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Paula E. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de venta de cosméticos donde ofrece los productos de perfumes, shampos, cremas, tintes para cabellos, entre otros.

Actualmente ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los cosméticos y por esta razón es que espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado para así dar continuidad a su negocio en su establecimiento en el departamento de León específicamente en el mercado central.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula E. is arduously dedicated to her cosmetics business, in which she sells perfume, shampoos, lotions, hair dyes, and other beauty products.

She is currently requesting this loan from Ceprodel so that she can purchase cosmetics, and for this reason she confidently waits for her loan to be granted, so that can keep her business afloat in the department of León, specifically in the central market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Ozodoy

texts.en:
Ozodoy is a happily married woman with four children. She has a friendly family who are always trying to help each other. Ozodoy is very hard-working and diligent, and takes pains to maintain economic stability within her home. She plants potatoes, onions and watermelon on her fertile crop land. Although losses from climate changes have often been substantial, she perseveres in her work because there have also been very profitable times. Ozodoy would like to acquire a larger quantity of chemical and natural fertilizers to raise the quality of her crops. She is counting on your help and thanks all of you sincerely.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora V. is from the village of Libertad Alto,sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Leonora is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 33 years and earns approximately 3,200.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Leonora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

Para Natividad la crianza de ganado es una actividad muy rentable, pues ella cuida muy bien a sus reses, las alimenta adecuadamente y las mantiene sanas, es por eso que su ganado es uno de los más solicitados en las ferias dominicales. 

Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es cuidar a sus animales, puesto que ella les tiene mucho cariño, por lo que espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene para mejorar sus ingresos. Lo más difícil para ella es llevar su ganado hasta las ferias, puesto que le es muy cansado, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograr alcanzar sus metas.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Natividad con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil soles solicitados planea comprar más forraje (pasto) para su ganado y así alimentarlo mejor.
texts.en:
Natividad, 30, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own house and what she wants most is to excel in life.

For Natividad, breeding cattle is a profitable activity as she looks after the cows very well, feeding them appropriately and maintaining their health. For this reason, her cows are among the most sought-after cattle at Sunday fairs.

She has been carrying out this activity for 10 years and most enjoys looking after her animals, which she does with much care, in the hope that she will be able to increase their number and improve her income. The hardest thing is taking her cattle to the fairs, which makes her very tired, but she knows that she must work very hard to achieve her goals.

This is the second loan for Natividad with MFP and she is ready to pay her instalments on time to avoid prejudicing the remaining partners of the communal bank, where she is well-loved for the responsibility she shows. With the 1,000 soles requested, she plans to buy more food (pasture) for her cattle to feed them better.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food for her animals

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa, D. 55 años, es una madre que a lo largo D. su vida siempre trabajo mucho por salir adelante. Vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos: Reyna D. 23 y Cesar D. 18 y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad D. vida.

Junto a su triciclo sale todos los días a vender frutas al mercado Las Mercedes (mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca), las frutas las compra D. los carros que llegan D. la ciudad D. Puerto Maldonado y tiene muy buen ojo para escogerlas. Ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que es una vendedora muy carismática y alegre.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, lleva 32 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día bajo el sofocante sol, lo cual hace que se canse más rápido. 
Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un puesto dentro del mercado, para vender sus frutas con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el sexto préstamo D. Justa con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, aunque para eso tenga que ahorrar poco a poco las ganancias D. sus ventas. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará más frutas para poder incrementar la cantidad D. mercadería que venD..
texts.en:
Justa is 55 years old and is a mother who throughout her life has worked hard to get ahead. She lives in her house with her two children: 23 year old Reyna and 18 year old Cesar. What she wants the most is to have a better quality of life. With her cart, she goes out everyday to sell fruit in Las Mercedes Market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She buys the fruit from the cars that arrive from Puerto Maldonado and has a very good eye for picking them. She has many customers, as she is a very charismatic and cheerful salesperson. What she likes the most about her work is talking with her neighbors in the market. She has been in this business for 32 years and she considers the most the most difficult thing to be to have to stay all day beneath the suffocating sun, which makes her tire quickly. For the future, she hopes to gather the necessary money to buy a place insiD. the market, so she can sell her fruit with more tranquility. This is Justa’s sixth loan with MFP. She is prepared to make her payments punctually, although for that she’ll have to save the earnings from her sales little by little. She is a very responsible member of her community bank. With the $525 (1500 PEN) requested, she will buy more fruit so that she can increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Susette

texts.en:
Susette V. is from the village of Usocan. She is 27 years old, is married, and has two infant children.

Susette owns and operates a business providing motorcycle and other motor vehicle equipment repair services to local community members. Her business is by the roadside and she provides assistance to those whose vehicles break down while driving, as well as typical repair to anyone who brings their equipment to her. Susette has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Susette joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital.

Susette is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es:
El Señor Manuel Salvador E. R., labora como encargado del mantenimiento y limpieza en el mercado Roberto Huembé Managua, el tiene a su cargo tres  hijos de los cuales dos  se encuentran en edad escolar,  es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con Ceprodel durante tres años, en ese lapso ha invertido   en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 4 Créditos otorgados que ha trabajado con Ceprodel, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción para cambiar el piso de la  vivienda en que habita y para el pago de la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Manuel Salvador E. R. works as the head of maintenance and cleaning in the Roberto Huembé Managua market. He cares for three children, two of whom are of school age, and he is single. He has had loans with Ceprodel for three years, and with these 4 loans, he has been able to improve his living conditions. He is an excellent client.

He seeks this loan to buy construction materials and to pay for labor costs to replace the floors in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for construction materials and labor costs to replace the floors in his home

loans.name: Phart

texts.en: Phart L., 28, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typicalL. make US$2 of profit a day. They also make and sell cow rope halters. This couple has two young children. Phart L. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase rope so that she and her husband can make cow rope halters to sell.

loans.use: To buy rope for cow rope halters.

loans.name: Navil

texts.es:
Navil es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad, que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 7 y una año de edad en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de dos años se dedica a crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y animales menores. El cría los animales en su casa y los vende a los compradores ocasionales que visitan su zona, también comercializa la leche que producen sus vacas entre sus vecinos. Estos negocios son la única fuente de ingreso familiar por lo que da todo de si para sacar su negocio adelante.

Navil desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de una vaca pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Navil desea seguir ampliando su negocio para brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad. El es un padre responsable y entregado a su familia y a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Navil is a 29 year old father who lives with his wife and two children (ages 7 and 1) in the district of Zaña, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, he has been raising and selling cattle and small animals. He raises these creatures at home and sells them to occasional buyers who visit the area. In addition, he sells milk produced by his cows to his neighbors. These businesses provide the only source of income for him to support his family and move his business forward.

Navil wants to grow his business by purchasing another cow, but he does not have sufficient capital in order for this to happen. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles so that he can meet his objective.

Navil hopes that his business will continue to grow so that he can provide his children with a quality education. He is a responsible father who is dedicated to his family and to his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Luis Eugenio

texts.es: Don Luis de 60 años de edad es habitante de la colonia San Jose, esta solicitandole a la institucion de AFODENIC su primer credito, el que usara para retencion de deternero, el objetivo de este productor es que esta financiera le otorgue este financiamiento de manera que sus animales puedan crecer y ganar mas peso generandole rentabilidad cuando sea su comercializacion y poder solventar necesidades en la economia familiar, posee una finca de 120mzs donde realiza sus actividades pecuarias y agricolas, sus hijos y su esposa colaboran en las actividades de su unidad de produccion siendo la misma  una fuente de empleo para mejorar las condiciones economicas a nivel familiar, Don Luis en la colonia donde el habita lo consideran como  hombre responsable, trabajador, productor humilde y con muchos deseos de superacion, su mayor anhelo es quedar bien con la institucion para seguir trabajando con apoyo de la misma.
texts.en:
Don Luis is 60 and lives in the town of San Jose. He is requesting his first loan from Afodenic, which he will use to raise calves. His objective is to receive this loan so his animals can grow to a heavier weight which will generate more profit for him when he sells them. He will be able to resolve his family's economic problems. He has a farm with 120 manzanas [about 200 acres] of land where he raises livestock and practices agriculture. His children and wife help him with these activities since it is the only source of work they have to improve their family's economic conditions. People in the town where he lives consider him to be a very responsible, hard-working, and humble man with many wishes of getting ahead. His biggest dream is to be seen favorably by Afodenic so he can keep receiving its support.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise calves

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces.
Marina es soltera, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Marina tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, además vende golosinas, artículos de escritorio, brinda servicios de fotocopiadora en el mismo local.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios para computadora.
Los sueños de Marina son ahorrar lo suficiente para su hijo y ampliar su local.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the communal bank called Los Sauces. She is 34 years old and raising her one son on her own. Marina runs an internet cafe from her home. In addition to selling internet access, she also sells sweet drinks, office supplies, and offers a photocopying service. Marina needs a loan to purchase computer accessories for her business. Her dream is to be able to save enough money to take good care of her son and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase computer accessories for her business

loans.name: Siem

texts.en: Mrs. Siem C. is 58 years old, a widow and has one son and three daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside of the family home. The other two work in a garment factory. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Siem is a farmer who makes a living growing vegetables. She is requesting a loan for $800 to put a roof on her house.

loans.use: To put a roof on her house.

loans.name: Maarouf

texts.en:
Maarouf is a married man, 40 years old, and has four school-age children. He works in the construction business, specializing in stonemasonry work. He makes special designs because he's talented in that work. He takes on both home projects and shop projects.

Today, Maarouf is requesting $1,200 to buy more tools and supplies needed for his job because he's planning to take on a new home project in the coming month and he needs to be ready.

loans.use: To buy more tools and supplies

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en: Marilyn L. is from the village of Guiwanon Panalsalan, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Marilyn is the group leader of a 2 member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Guava 1. Marilyn is married and has 2 infant children. Marilyn owns and operates a business selling daily use products such as sugar, shampoo, noodles, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lily's Group

texts.en: Lily R. is from the village of Tawagan Norte, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 54 years old and is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Lily is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. Lily joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. Lily plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es: La señora Aura se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, de edad de 50 años, con cuatro hijos, solo dos están a su cargo y estudian un par de gemelas ya que las otras están casadas. Su esposo trabaja como ejecutivo de venta, el cual dio dinero para comenzar la venta de ropa. Para ayudar con los gastos ya que todo a incrementado a demás por que le gusta ser una mujer emprendedora y que sus hijas tengan la iniciativa en un futuro de tener su propio negocio. Pues poco a poco ha logrado vender zapatos, carteras varios productos. Con este préstamo comprara ropa, zapatos y cosmético para aumentar el inventario y lograr mejores ventas. Sus planes es lograr poner una farmacia en donde también lograra vender sus productos actuales, esto beneficiaria al desarrollo y crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Aura sells clothing and cosmetics. She is 50 years old and has four children. Only two of which are in her care, they are twins and are in school, the others are married. Her husband works as a sales executive, which provided the money to begin the clothing sales. She started the business to help with the rising expenses and also because she would like to be an entrepreneurial woman. Aura wants her daughters to have the initiative in the future to have their own business. Little by little she has increased her business to sell shoes and various products. With this loan she will buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics to increase her inventory and to support better sales. Her plan is to create a pharmacy in which she can also sell her products, this will benefit the development and growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy: clothes, shoes and cosmetics to increase her inventory and to increase sales

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen R. is 41 years of age, married, and a resident of Labuyo, Tangub City. Her husband is a local government employee for Tangub City and the couple is blessed with four children aged 8, 12, 14 and 16 years old. 
Helen has skills in cooking and business management. To help her husband in supporting their family, she decided to engage in business and opened a restaurant business. For three years, she has been able to manage her business and is now earning an average net income of not less than 3,000 PHP per month. These earnings are very helpful to her family. She has taken a number of loans and her previous loan was for 8,000 PHP. Now she is requesting her fifth loan, of 10,000 PHP, to add to her capital for her existing eatery and sari-sari store business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve her family's living conditions, to meet their basic needs and as savings for future use. Helen is hoping that someday her business will become more progressive.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her restaurant

loans.name: Fe Pekit Group

texts.en:
Fe P. is from the village of Mialen,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and the leader of a 6-member group loan offered by PMPC.  While each member receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the entire loan if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Fe is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Fe has been in business for over 16 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional products to sell.  She is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for future emergencies. 

--------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Ciudad Eten, un distrito conocido por sus sombreros y muebles tejidos de paja. Se encuentra ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace quince años a la venta de condimentos al por mayor y menor en el mercado de su distrito, el atiende en su negocio todos los dias y debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad se ha vuelto muy conocido en el rubro. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para la economía de su familia, junto a su esposa se esfuerzan para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras.

Carlos desea adquirir mas condimentos para tener una mayor cantidad de productos en su puesto de trabajo y aumentar sus ventas y ganancias, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Carlos es una persona trabajadora y que siempre se esfuerza por sacar a su familia adelante. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 37 year old married man with two children. He lives with his family in a district of Eten; a district well known for its sombreros and straw woven furniture. He is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He's been selling condiments wholesale and retail in his district for the past 11 years. He tends to his own business everyday and due to the length of time he's been working, he's become well known in the business. This business is of most importance to his family's economy. His wife sells vegetables and togther they struggle to get ahead. Carlos wishes to purchase more condiments in order to have a large quantity of product at his job post and increase his sales and earnings. That is why he has requested a loan for 300 dollars to Edpyme Alternativa in order to reach his objective. Carlos is a hard working person who always tries to get his family ahead. He has worked previously with our institution and he has shown responsibility and punctuality when it comes to making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments to grow sales

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: A. Henriette est née en 1984 à Tori, au Bénin. Mariée à AYOSSO Didier, un mécanicien, Henriette est mère d'un enfant, qui est scolarisé. Henriette a un autre enfant à sa charge. Henriette vit depuis huit ans environs au quartier Cocotomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, avec son mari et ses deux enfants à charge. Henriette apporte une aide financière à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Henriette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Henriette vend des condiments de sauce et des produits vivriers (riz, farine de manioc, etc.) à son domicile. Henriette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Henriette a bénéficié déjà de deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés à ALIDé. Henriette désire agrandir son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un troisième crédit. Plus tard, Henriette ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour y vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Henriette was born in 1984 in Tori, in Benin. Married to Mr. AYOSSO Didier, a mechanic, she is the mother of one child, who is in school, and has another child to support. Henriette has been living with her husband and two children for about eight years in the Cocotomey district, in the community of Abomey Calavi. She helps out her husband financially with regards to their family expenses, thanks to the revenues from her business. Henriette did not attend school. She has been selling sauce condiments and staple foods (rice, cassava flour, etc.) out of her home. She purchases her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has already had two loans from ALIDé that have both been repaid. She would like to expand her business and to respond better to customer demand. Later on, Henriette has the ambition to open a store for selling her products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 2 baskets of tomatoes, 3 baskets of chili peppers, and 2 sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Vian John

texts.en:
Vian John Q. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old and is married with four adult children. Vian John owns and operates a business providing motor-cab transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Vian John joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Vian John is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong T. N. is 56 years old. She grows rice and raises pigs and poultry. She has had this job for many years. Her husband is a bricklayer. She has a son who is married. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 4,142,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy food for the pigs and poultry. She is the leader of the group.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Anh T. N. is 40 years old. She would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND in order to expand her store. Van T. T. N. is 38 years old. She would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND in order to breed poultry. Loi T. N. is 46 years old. She would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to breed pigs.

loans.use: To buy food for the pigs and poultry

loans.name: Flor Hazel

texts.en:
Flor Hazel is a hardworking entrepreneur who is always looking for opportunities to grow. Through her daily effort, she is building a better future for her family. 

The fishing business has brought happiness to Flor Hazel’s family. Because of its profits, she has been able to support her family’s needs. Being a good mother, Flor has always wanted to support her children in whatever career they would be taking to better their own personal life. The fishing business is her way of saving money to support the needs of her family, especially to pay for her six children's education until college.

Her husband’s support of her fishing business is Flor Hazel’s motivation to continue expanding her business despite the trials of poverty. Over time, she has been able to purchase a fishing boat for her husband to manage and use for fishing. Meanwhile, Flor Hazel is the one who sells his fish directly to people in local community and nearby town of Tobias Fornier, Antique.

Flor Hazel is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase an additional fishing boat to catch more fish to sell. This would help their business grow, and make more profit, which will enable her to support her ambition in life.

loans.use: purchasing an additional fishing boat

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia A. is from the village of Birayan, Rizal. She is 58 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Venancia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling assorted crops from her own farm. Venancia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Venancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venancia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Venancia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Venancia from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El señor Nelson tiene 34 años, se dedica brindar el servicio vulcanización y venta de combustible. Tiene 2 hijos, ambos menores de edad a su cargo. Nelson inicio desde hace 4 años el brinda un excelente servicio, la mayoría de sus clientes se sienten muy satisfechos, por lo que ha sido muy reconfortante
Actualmente tiene una clientela que vive cerca de su vivienda.Solicita el préstamo para la compra de combustible y además llantas, herramientas y aumentar su inventario de mercadería.
texts.en:
Sr. Nelson, 34, operates a tire-repair and gasoline-sales business. He has 2 young children, both of whom depend on him. Nelson started the business 4 years ago. He provides an excellent service to his customers, who are drawn from the neighborhood, and the majority of whom are repeat customers. Nelson is applying for a loan to buy gasoline and tires for the business, along with tools and other supplies that he will stock for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Freddy Daniel

texts.es: El  Sr. Freddy  Daniel M. M. él es trabajador activo del Hotel Barceló  Montelimar Masa chapa  se desempeña  como Botone, tiene doce años de trabajar para esta empresa, tiene tres niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales construcción  para mejorar su casa de habitación, estos  créditos con la financiera le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que sin estas ayudas no pueden   mejorar su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Freddy Daniel M. M. works as a bellboy at the Hotel Barceló Montelimar in Masa Chapa, a job he's been doing for twelve years. He has three school-aged children.

Freddy has had two loans with Kiva partner CEPRODEL and has used them to buy construction material to  make improvements to his house. These loans with the financial institution have greatly benefitted him already as without this assistance his living standards and those of his family could not have been improved.

loans.use: to buy construction material like sand, cement etc.

loans.name: Por

texts.en: Mr. Por V. is an old man whose wife appears on the photo above, and they are local villagers living in Kampong Tom Province. This couple is married with seven children, six of whom are single and one is married. Por V. is a village consultant adviser, while his wife is currently a recycling seller. Two of Por V.'s daughters have been providing an embellishing service for new couples many years, and they are also hired from people who will marry. Now, his daughters still require more materials to support their service. So that is why Mr. Por V. requests a loan for his children use to buy more wedding decorative materials.

loans.use: To buy more wedding decorative materials.

loans.name: Nestor Javier

texts.es: EL Sr. Néstor mas conocido tiene 41 años de edad oriundo de la ciudad de la Paz  El Sr. vive con su esposa en una casa Familiar,  junto a sus 2 hijos uno de 16 años y otro de 3 añitos de edad se dedica al Trasporte publico dueño de microbús y con una Derecho de línea el dinero de solicito es para la compra de llantas recauchutadas (refaccionadas) para su microbús ya que ya están muy viejas las que actualmente tiene. Además el Sr  Néstor esta ahorrando para poder comprarse muy pronto una casa para poder habitarla junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos y así brindarles comodidad ya que viven un poco incomodas, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Néstor is very well known in his community. A native of La Paz, he is 41 years old and he lives in a family house with his wife and their two children, aged 16 and 3. He engages in public transport: he owns a microbus and a permit for one line. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy retreaded (repaired) tires for his microbus, as the ones he is actually using are very old. He is also saving in order to buy a house in the near future: he wants to offer a comfortable dwelling to his wife and children, as at the moment they are living in uncomfortable conditions. He is deeply thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy retreaded tires for his microbus.
